â€‰ Malorie Blackman's NOUGHTS AND CROSSES penned as a saga for young adults and published in instalments between 2001 and 2021, serves as the source material for Dominic Cooke's hard-hitting stage adaptation, here directed by Tinuke Craig. Noah Valentine (Callum) and Corinna Brown (Sephy) in Noughts & Crosses. Credit Manuel Harlan. Essentially, this is a loose retelling of Romeo and Juliet set in a 21st century alternative Britain, in which the Noughts are poor disadvantaged white folks and the Crosses are the all-powerful and wealthy black folks. It's a neat premise which requires considerable thinking to embed when read off the page, but when presented in such a charged and visually arresting setting â€” thanks to the effectiveness of Colin Richmond's drab, pseudo industrial backdrop â€” the story assumes a vibrant energy all its own. Persephone (Corinna Brown) who is known to everyone save her mother as Sephy, has been childhood friends with a Nought named Callum (Noah Valentine) whose mother Meggie (Kate Kordel) used to clean for Sephy's parents Jasmine (Amanda Bright) and Kamal (Habib Nasib Nader) who just happens to be Deputy Prime Minister of Albion, part of the wider Pangaean Economic Community. The downtrodden Nought (white) population, is mobilising through a liberation movement to press for equal rights and opportunities. Elite schools previously reserved for Crosses (blacks) have begun taking small quotas of Nought scholarship students, and in a nod to the civil rights movement (specifically the Little Rock Nine incidents of 1957) riots and unrest quickly ensue. As Sephy and Callum become ever closer but have to hide their affection at school, they form tentative plans to run away together. Events and society conspire to keep them apart leading to various tragedies including a shopping centre bombing, clampdowns, executions and suicide. For all that this list of misery sounds morose, the drama unfolds in neatly packaged chapters with sufficient humour, charm, variety, pace and choreographed movement across the sprawling playing area, to thoroughly engage the audience. Make no mistake, any attempt to distil such a sprawling epic into a stage play with a running time of 2 hours 50 mins (including the 20 min interval) is no mean feat, but hats off to the creative team who have conjured a substantial piece of thought-provoking, dystopian social commentary, whilst still managing to engage and entertain. Noughts & Crosses Tickets Further cast members who appear in the production: Alec Boaden (Jude), Halle Brown (Lola & Juno), Michael Cusick (Mr Stanhope & Peter), Elle Davies (Shania & Leila), Eddie Elliott (Mr Corsa, Collins & Jack), Emma Jane Goodwin (Sarah Pike), Jessica Layde (Minerva), Wela Mbusi (Mr Pingule & Governor), Yolanda Ovide (Dionne & Clerk), Helena Pipe (Reporter, Kelanie & Joannie), Richard Riddell (Ryan), Ben Skym (Colin & Morgan) and Chanel Waddock (Lynette).

â€‰ The Princess of Wales oozed confidence in pastels and Chanel at her final Wimbledon appearance. Rachel Burchfield is the contributing royals editor at InStyle, where she covers news about the British royal family on a daily basis, including the work and wardrobes of Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle. Published on July 9, 2025 @ 07:33AM Close Princess Diana at Wimbledon on July 9, 1995. Credit: Getty Long before Kate Middleton took the mantle, Princess Diana was a Wimbledon style icon. The former Princess of Wales first attended the iconic tennis tournament in 1981, just weeks before her royal wedding to Prince Charles, and last attended in 1995, just two years before her death. For that final Wimbledon appearance 30 years ago, Diana wore butter yellow before butter yellow became the it shade, and paired it with standout Chanel jewelry that guaranteed she'd be noticed in the Royal Box. On July 9, 1995â€”30 years ago todayâ€”Princess Diana had just turned 34 years old. That is far too young to have any â€œlasts.â€ But, on that Sunday, the Princess of Wales would attend what would ultimately become her last Wimbledon after being a stylish spectator at the iconic tennis tournament since 1981, the year she married into the royal family. Sitting in the royal box in butter yellow, she would have no idea that her summers were limitedâ€”only two left to go before her life was snuffed out in a Paris car crash on August 31, 1997. But rather than focus on her death, Diana was living her best life at Wimbledon on that day. For 14 years, Diana's fashion had defined Wimbledon chic, and this was no exception. While there is no official dress code for guestsâ€”save for the men being asked to wear a jacket and tie if they're in the Royal Box, and the women being asked to avoid wearing hats so the people behind them could clearly see the tennis happening on the court belowâ€”the unspoken dress code is dress well, especially if you're at Centre Court like Diana was that day. â€œThe fashion stakes are high,â€ Vogue succinctly put it. Getty That day, Diana left behind the polka dots and the oversized power shoulders of the 1980s for a pastel yellow skirt suit, fashion-forward sunglasses, and statement gold and pearl earrings from Chanel. That day, she took in the men's final between Boris Becker and Pete Sampras in a look representative of her fashion evolution, not just at Wimbledon, but as a woman. At previous Wimbledon appearances, she was often joined in the Royal Box by loved ones: Her son, Prince William, the year before; her mother, Frances Shand Kydd; her sister-in-law and friend Sarah Ferguson, Duchess of York; and friends like Catherine Soames. However, in 1995, she chatted with Queen Elizabeth's first cousin, the Prince of Kent. Sometimes Diana's Wimbledon appearances fell on her birthday, July 1, and the crowd would sing to her, but this time, she presented the men's singles trophy to Pete Sampras. Following his victory over Boris Becker, the tennis starâ€”though he was the champion of the dayâ€”bowed in the direction of the Princess of Wales, according to The New York Times. Diana loved Wimbledon, by all appearances, and exuberantly took in matches each year she attended, animatedly applauding and giving the signature Wimbledon facial expressions that her daughter-in-law, Kate Middleton, now displays at the yearly event (she's attended every Wimbledon of her royal career save for 2013, when she was heavily pregnant with Prince George). In July 1995, Diana had been separated from Prince Charles for over two years; they'd finally finalized their divorce the next summer, in 1996. Their separation in 1992 was a demarcation point for her style: as Rosie Hart, author of The Royal Wardrobe, put it (via The Independent), â€œGoing into the '90s, the Princess of Wales was under no illusion that her marriage was the fairytale it had initially been framed as. Consequently, the frothy, fairytale elements of her wardrobe, inspired by the traditional looks of the more senior royals, began to disappear.â€ Princess Diana and the Prince of Kent on July 9, 1995. Getty More structured and tailored looksâ€”like her 1995 Wimbledon suitâ€”became the new norm. Diana, always a fan of butter yellow long before it became the It color of 2025, brought the look out 30 years earlier in keeping with royal tradition (bright colors were Queen Elizabeth's go-to at public events). Kate, too, has adopted yellow at Wimbledon, and, like her mother-in-law before her, can tell a fashion story through her clothes. â€œIt is very surprising how little footage there exists of the princess [Diana] actually speaking,â€ Eleri Lynn, curator of the Kensington Palace exhibit â€œDiana: Her Fashion Story,â€ told Vanity Fair, comparing Diana's style to â€œan Audrey Hepburn or Jackie Kennedy, a fashion icon whose style is so emulated and so loved, really.â€ â€œWe all have a sense of what we think she was like, and yet so much of it comes from still photographs, and a large part of that [idea] is communicated through the different clothes that she wore,â€ Lynn continued, pointing to Diana's affinity for â€œCheerful, colorful clothes because she wanted to convey approachability and warmth.â€ Princess Diana at Wimbledon on July 3, 1994. Getty Prince William and Princess Diana at Wimbledon. Getty Lynn added that Diana â€œdid clearly have fun with fashion, and she took risksâ€¦and experimented with her style.â€ By this point in her fashion journey, Diana â€œhad really sort of transcended fashion and achieved an incredible chic and elegance,â€ Lynn said, to the point that â€œall you saw was her, and the clothes became secondary to her own presence and her work.â€ In the more modern era, Diana's style still resonates. Designers like Tory Burch and Virgil Abloh have created looks inspired by her; Hailey Bieberâ€”one of the most fashion-forward of today's It Girlsâ€”once said Diana is someone â€œI've looked to for style inspiration for as long as I can remember.â€ Princess Diana at Wimbledon in 1993. Getty Princess Diana and Prince William at Wimbledon. Getty Especially at events like Wimbledon, Diana â€œspoke to the world so much through what she decided to wear,â€ Jessica Hobbs, who directed two of the Diana-focused episodes of Netflix's The Crown's fourth season, told The Los Angeles Times. â€œIn my generation, she was such a fundamental leader in the way that you could present yourself as a woman, and I loved her for that.â€...

â€‰ I went into this play 'blind' â€“ there were, as others in the press night audience helpfully pointed out, six novels and three novellas in the Noughts & Crosses series written by Malorie Blackman. There's also a drama series based on the novels, still available at the time of writing on BBC iPlayer â€“ six episodes are almost an hour long and four more are fifty minutes long. This play is based on the first novel only, although this is 449 pages long, so there's still a fair amount of ground to cover in an evening. Chanel Waddock (Lynette) and Noah Valentine (Callum) in Noughts & Crosses (c) Manuel Harlan The marketing for this production likens it to Romeo & Juliet: the analogy doesn't quite work for me. There were â€œtwo householdsâ€ but they were not â€œalike in dignityâ€. The world portrayed by the play is one of apartheid. The 'Noughts', so to speak, are the 'whites' and the 'Crosses' are the 'coloureds' â€“ except here, the Crosses are the ones with the wealth, the power, the authority, the land, and so on. The Noughts are zeroes, nobodies â€“ noughts. It's an intriguing take on an alternative society, which brings Animal Farm to mind, as the inequalities remain and by the end, things seem worse than they were at the beginning. A Cross, Persephone 'Sephy' Hadley (Corinna Brown), lives with her parents, Kamal (Habib Nasib Nader), deputy prime minister, and Jasmine (Amanda Bright), a socialite who does nothing but drink excessively and gossip with her friends but still manages to make more of a net positive contribution to society than her politician husband. (How much of an alternative universe is this to modern Britain?) Jasmine used to employ Meggie McGregor (Kate Kordel) as a nanny for Sephy and her older sister, Minerva (Jessica Layde), and Meggie's younger son, Callum (Noah Valentine), used to play with Sephy when they were very little. Or to put it another way, when they first became friends, Sephy didn't know Callum was a Nought and Callum didn't know Sephy was a Cross. The twist in the story comes when Heathcroft, a public school for Crosses, decides to accept a small number of Noughts as pupils. Amongst them is Callum McGregor. It's not clear why this happened, given the extremely deep hatred the Crosses have for the Noughts, and vice versa â€“ after all, doesn't the upper caste think the lower caste is, by definition, intellectually challenged? Why educate people who are never going to be given opportunities in later life to use their acquired knowledge? Or is the world in the play ever so slightly less draconian than I assumed it to be? (Given what transpires later, no.) I was somewhat triggered by the school bullies in the show â€“ I suppose very few portrayals of school life are altogether, if at all, positive. All they see is Sephy hanging out with Callum, and how dare a Cross even speak to a Nought, let alone befriend one! This wasn't the first time on this stage that a character was about to be hanged only for there to be a last-minute reprieve â€“ the same thing happened in a production of The Beggar's Opera in 2011. Elsewhere, a subplot about Callum's sister Lynette (Chanel Waddock) is worthy of a separate play in its own right. The production values are high â€“ while some people might be talking unfeasibly loud in a private residence, being able to hear every word clearly completely obliterates that anomaly. The cast are very convincing in their roles. Whether they were planning direct action against the establishment, or delivering a letter, there was a sense of urgency throughout the play. Noughts & Crosses has much to say about tensions in the community, inequalities in society, political inertia, and terrorism in the modern world, amongst other things. A thoughtful, gripping and unsettling production, it's worth seeing. Review by Chris Omaweng 'All our lives criss-crossing but never really touching. A world full of strangers living with all that fear.' Widely considered to be one of the 21st century's greatest novels,Â Malorie Blackman's best-sellingÂ NoughtsÂ & Crosses, a bittersweet love story with echoes of Shakespeare's Romeo & Juliet, is revived for the London stage in this brand-new production. By a secluded beach Callum and Sephy meet in secret; life-long friends living on separate sides of a divided world. When Callum, from a Nought family, is accepted to Sephy's prestigious Cross school, will it bring them closer, or will the hate and fear that surrounds them drive them apart? The global home fragrance market, valued at approximately US$ 9.0 billion in 2022, is poised for significant growth over the coming decade. Driven by evolving consumer preferences and a surge in demand for premium lifestyle products, the market is expected to expand at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 5.4% from 2023 to 2031, reaching an estimated valuation of US$ 14.5 billion by the end of 2031. This growth trajectory reflects rising awareness of home ambiance and wellness, with consumers increasingly embracing scented candles, diffusers, air fresheners, and other fragrance products to enhance living spaces. Access key findings and insights from our Report in this sample - Market Size and Growth In 2022, the market stood at a robust US$ 9.0 billion and is projected to grow steadily at a CAGR of 5.4% through 2031. This impressive growth is fueled by increased disposable incomes, rising urbanization, and a growing preference for home personalization. The expansion of e-commerce platforms has also facilitated easier consumer access to a wide variety of home fragrance products. Furthermore, the surge in health consciousness has led to demand for natural and organic fragrances, propelling growth across premium and niche product categories. Market Segmentation The home fragrance market is segmented by product type, distribution channel, and consumer demographics. Key product categories include scented candles, air fresheners, reed diffusers, incense sticks, and essential oils. Among these, scented candles and air fresheners dominate due to their widespread use and variety. Distribution channels encompass supermarkets/hypermarkets, specialty stores, online retail, and convenience stores, with online sales experiencing rapid growth owing to changing shopping habits. Additionally, segmentation by consumer demographics reveals strong demand from millennials and Gen Z, who prioritize product aesthetics, sustainability, and personalized fragrance experiences. Explore our report to uncover in-depth insights - Regional Analysis Geographically, the market is segmented into North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, Latin America, and the Middle East & Africa. North America and Europe remain leading markets due to high consumer awareness and established retail infrastructures. The Asia-Pacific region, however, is anticipated to exhibit the highest growth rate, driven by rising urban middle-class populations and increasing disposable income in countries like China, India, and Japan. Emerging markets in Latin America and the Middle East & Africa also present significant opportunities, as consumers in these regions adopt Western lifestyle trends and invest in home care products. Competitive Landscape The home fragrance market is highly fragmented with a mix of global giants and niche domestic players vying for market share. Prominent manufacturers include Procter & Gamble, S.C. Johnson & Son, Godrej Consumer Products, Reckitt Benckiser Group, Newell Brands, MINISO, Airwick, Chanel SA, 3M Company, Esteban Paris, Bridgewater Candle Company, and Copenhagen Candle Company. These companies leverage strong distribution networks, innovative product lines, and brand loyalty to maintain competitive edges. Strategic partnerships, acquisitions, and product launches are common strategies adopted to capture evolving market opportunities. â€‰ Writer: Malorie Blackman, adapted by Dominic Cooke Director: Tinuke Craig To first read Malorie Blackman's young adult novel Noughts & Crosses is to be intrigued, tantalised. Who are these privileged Crosses, this underclass of Noughts? Dramatised, it's all clear from the start. Blackman's premise is of an inverted society. White people are the despised Noughts, marginalised in a society run by the Black majority. It's a clever idea which allows Blackman to expose the workings of structural racism and its dangerously divisive effects. And centrally, it's a love story between Sephy and Callum â€“ Sephy, a Cross, the younger daughter of the deputy prime minister and Callum from a struggling Nought family. Their friendship began in childhood when Callum's mother worked for Sephy's mother. Dominic Cooke's adaptation, directed for Regent's Park Open Air Theatre by Tinuke Craig, is lively and fast paced, but inevitably, much of the book's subtleties are lost. The action plays out in a sequence of short, punchy scenes, but there is little time for character development. In particular, we don't really see into the inner world of Sephy and Callum, whose voices we hear in the book narrating the chapters alternately. This production has a strong cast, with likeable performances from the young performers, in particular Corinna Brown as Sephy and Noah Valentine as Callum. Chanel Waddock is notable as Lynette, Callum's complex and vulnerable older sister. Other characters tend to be two-dimensional, not giving much scope for the actors. So Alex Boaden does his best with bullying older brother Jude, as do Kate Kordel and Richard Riddell as parents Meggie and Ryan. Amanda Bright gives a strong performance as Jasmine, Sephy's mother, as does Habib Nasib Nader as Kamal, her husband. Craig uses the rest of the cast to haunt the story, always present in the upper regions of the set, ready to spring into action. But this is essentially an intimate story, its focus on the handful of characters whose lives lie at its centre. Colin Richmond's set, with its rusted remnants of tower blocks, presents a bleak world. It's certainly appropriate for the Noughts, though barely suggestive of the contrasting world of the wealthy Crosses. Many of the love scenes take place in secret at the private beach owned by Sephy's family, which can only be suggested by Max Pappenheim's sound design. There's a drabness about the costumes, too, which tends to flatten the distinction between Noughts and Crosses. This production is aimed at young adults, and it has the appeal of an exciting story arc and plenty of dramatic tension. But it's overly schematic and tends to muffle the intimacy of the central love story, which should lie at its heart. Runs until 26 July 2025 The Reviews Hub Score

â€‰ SPR_COMBO[it]di LETIZIA GUAGLIARDI -Â ÃˆÂ un giorno speciale perchÃ© annuncio con gioia che, direttamente dalla stazione di Acquachescorre, Ã¨ arrivato ilÂ â€œDiario d'estate di Poppy Springâ€. Quando si pubblica un nuovo libro le emozioni sono tante perchÃ© il percorso per arrivare fin qui Ã¨ sempre lungo e non privo di difficoltÃ , a cominciare dalla fase creativa, passando poi all'editing e, infine, alla stampa. Ore, giorni, mesi immersa in un lavoro fatto con dedizione e passione. Un progetto impegnativo perchÃ© ha inglobato non solo la fase di scrittura ma anche quella dell'illustrazione e ora si aggiunge anche la trepidazione dell'attesa di avere dei riscontri da parte dei lettori. PerchÃ© quando si pubblica qualcosa, anche un semplice post, ci si espone al giudizio degli altri e, quindi, si diventa vulnerabili. Dopo il diario di primavera, eccoci a quello dell'estate, con tutte le novitÃ  che porta nel borgo di Acquachescorre. Come ho giÃ  detto per il primo libro di questa serie dedicata alle stagioni, questo diario non Ã¨ dedicato solo alle adolescenti ma a tutte le donne dai 9 ai 99 anni che non hanno mai smesso di mantenere in vita laÂ â€œPoppy Springâ€Â che Ã¨ dentro di loro: il senso della meraviglia, la creativitÃ , l'entusiasmo, la ricerca continua della Bellezza, la gratitudine per le piccole cose. E lo consiglio anche agli uomini che vogliono donare questo libro alleÂ Poppy SpringÂ che hanno intorno. Anche qui Poppy condivide le sue esperienze, sempre con ironia, da sola, con gli amici, con la famiglia. Ci sono i libri, i viaggi, la cucina, il matrimonio di zia Ortensia, le serate nella trattoria â€œLa bruschetta che ti aspettaâ€ e le emozioni tra i fornelli con mamma Genziana e la signora Passiflora. â€‰ Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com Molly-Mae Hague has splashed out on a new convertible Bentley as she was spotted out and about running errands in Cheshire on Wednesday morning. The influencer, 26, spared no expense with her brand new Â£294,000 sports car with smart black alloys and upgraded red calipers. Molly looked at ease behind the wheel as she cut a casual figure in a white collard jumper and wore a full palette of glamorous makeup. During the outing, the mother-of-one, who admitted she struggled to park one of the brand's cars last year, placed her Â£9K Chanel handbag on the passenger seat. Molly,Â who has a Â£6million fortune, was surrounded by cameras on the solo drive filming her for the second series of her Amazon Prime docu-series. Last year in a YouTube video, Molly opened up on her former Bentley experience as she struggled to park the vehicle by the brand. She said: 'It's just very exciting. I believe the car I'm driving is the Bentley Bentayga, I think that's what it is. It's a four-by-four but I'm pretty sure that the four-by-four Bentleys are called a Bentayga. 'But, oh my gosh, I genuinely never ever thought there was ever a car out there that would make me want to switch from my car because the [Mercedes] G-Wagon has always been a whole dream car but this is something else. 'My friend earlier just said that sitting in a Bentley is like sitting in a Chanel bag and that couldn't have summed it up any better. 'The interior of this car is pure luxury and I don't know how to act whilst driving it, put it that way.' However, Molly struggled to fit the car in a parking spot at the Trafford Centre, she added: 'What are we waiting for, loves? What's going on?' She is also the owner of her 'dream car' a Mercedes-AMG G 63 Magno Edition, purchased in 2022 to the tune of Â£193,000. The reality star has also been the owner of a black Ranger Rover Evoque worth a staggering Â£32,000, however, after just nine months of using the car, Molly revealed that she was gifting her Range Rover to her sister Zoe. Despite getting her sisters hopes up, Molly eventually revealed she 'put her sensible hat on' and decided to sell the car and buy Zoe a cheaper one. She said: 'It was probably about a year ago that I made a plan to give my Range Rover to my sister because I grew so attached to my last car that I really, really didn't want to get rid of it when I got this car. 'However, I had planned to gift it to my sister before I found out I was pregnant. How do I explain this? If I wasn't pregnant and didn't have a lot of other things to be spending money on maybe I would have still given her my car. 'But I decided in the end to sell my car, which was very sad. I still got Zoe a new car - she's upgraded to an Audi. I didn't give her the Range Rover. I wanted to give it her so I could still see it but I just had to put my sensible hat on.' The influencer has been regularly slapped with parking tickets and last month was given two within the space of 24hours. The TV personality has also received parking fines in March, February and January of this year. The former Love Island star revealed she'd begun shooting the second season of her documentary series, Behind It All, last month. TheÂ Prime Video series saw the influencer give fans a glimpse into her life, from running her clothing brand to parenting two-year-old Bambi. She shares her daughter with on-again boyfriendÂ Tommy Fury, who she recently reconciled with, after their surprise split in August last year. However, MailOnline revealed last month that the boxer, 26, still won't appear on her docuseries, despite the couple being back together. It was previously confirmed that Tommy is unable to show his face on the Prime Video series due to his contractual agreements with the BBCÂ as he films documentary The Good, The Bad, The Fury, set for release later this year. Molly-Mae confirmed Behind It All would return for a second season last month, after the first became a viral hit at the start of the year. Writing on Instagram, she gushed: 'My mood because it's filming day ONE for SEASON 2!!! 'I can't believe I'm saying this but because of all of your love and support with 'Molly-Mae: Behind It All'â€¦ we are coming BACK with another season! Pinch me.' A TV source explained to MailOnline that the second series will be less 'relationship focused' as Molly continues to build her 'business empire' and navigate family dilemmas with mother Deborah and sister Zoe. An insider said: 'Molly-Mae was over the moon that Behind It All was so well received and popular among her fanbase, she's more than happy to continue sharing more personal aspects of her life with the cameras. 'This season will be as jam-packed as the last, with Molly testing living arrangements, taking on challenges, and making some life altering decisions, all while managing her business ventures. 'Viewers shouldn't expect to see Tommy on the show because he still won't appear even though him and Molly are very much together now.' The debut six-part docuseries became the streamer's most watched show on Prime Video by young women aged 18-34. It followed Molly-Mae as she navigated her public breakup from Tommy, who later revealed the reason for their split was because he had been struggling with alcohol addiction. It also tracked the launch of Maebe, Molly-Mae's first fashion brand, and her complicated relationship with sister Zoe, who felt protective over the YouTuber getting back with Tommy before they had properly worked through their issues.

â€‰ First impressions: 1. Groove is still in the heart. Dee-lite's Lady Miss Kir dressed as Cher from Clueless. 2A. Bad case of "these are the designers I'm wearing"--I GOT MUSTARD ON MY VERSACE! DID YOU HEAR ME? MY VERSACE! MUSTARD ON IT! 2B. Spotted wearing giant Chanel logo on chain in next episode promos 2C. Don't touch the "emotional support Birkin"--bitch bring a dog like everyone else. 3. Entire interview dedicated to letting us know she wasn't a gold digger, then presents photo showing younger self coyly seated atop rich old man's lap. OK toots. Just own it. That pic wasn't taken on his break from his janitor shift, it was taken on his private plane. SOMETHING made him attractive... 4. Seems hard working, I like that. 5. Has inserted finger into a chicken, always a handy bon mot to bring up at a baby shower. Props. Martina once again is dragged off to some party where she gamely pretends to support her wife in all her endeavors, including appreciating Kiki twerking in her face and examining the contents of a diaper. Guerdy is filmed crying to Russell about having water thrown at her as though she were the Wicked Witch. In fact, she does highly resemble Elphaba and this could be her ticket to Broadway and being Very Rich, Bitch like Nene's former glory days. Put a pin in that one. Russell expresses concern that Julia, a quote "very large, tall woman" was STANDING OVER his beloved while she is still recovering from breast cancer (no statute of limitations on that one I guess). Umm, has he ever seen Guerdy stand up? Aren't they all rather tall other than Marysol and maybe Lisa and Adriana? Speaking of Lisa--praise be to the editors for that magical juxtaposition of Jody and the Furby. I laughed so hard I startled my dog. Marysol has been suspiciously sober this season so far. I'm glad for her, but sad for myself. I wonder if it will last. Larsa stages a phone call with a [s]witness[/s] friend for backup regarding her story about Jody's suspiciously amped behavior at the "fashion" show they attended. Was this a no-phones-allowed event? She could have just recorded him and shown us all, but I guess maybe that's discouraged by the editors, IDK. Alexia --I cannot muster up even one giveadamn about her marriage to whatever his name was. If this was the best storyline she could come up with, her days as a HW are numbered.

â€‰ Thank you to jessicajudebooks for kindly sending me an ARC of Queen of Vengeance. Blurb â€œWhat are you going to do when you find him?â€ I pause, unsure what my answer should be. But there's only ever been one option. â€œKill him,â€ I say. Slate Life's taught me not to expect much. Handouts, fair treatment, a decent parking spot downtown. But dead last on that list? Lux Colombia-Clarke showing up at my door, looking like a damn fairytale with a score to settle. Her proposal knocks me sideways: find the city's most dangerous drug dealer, and she'll make sure my sister gets what she needs. I'd be an idiot to refuse, but every time her eyes cut my way, something dark and electric stirs in me. She's trouble wrapped in silk, and I'd be wise to stay clear. Good thing no one ever accused me of being wise. Lux Trust me, I can think of better things to do than begging a prime-parking-spot-stealing jerk for help. Like, a million better things. But this leather-clad biker may be the only way to help my brother. If I can endure the boulder-sized attitude he's carrying around. We had a deal. One that didn't include feeling â€¦ safe. Protected. Happy. Like, wtf? In no universe do we make sense together. He looks as out of place in a tuxedo as I do in anything other than vintage Chanel. But when we're together, it's like none of that matters. Until, of course, it does. And then nothing will stand in the way of our epic mutual destruction. Queen of Vengeance is perfect for readers looking for: Contemporary romance books Old money aesthetics Small town biker + high class socialite vibes Morally gray characters & darker themes Enemies to lovers Dual POVs Opposites attract Grumpy x sunshine tropes Spicy love stories Bad boy alpha heroes Angsty and emotional stories Queen of Vengeance is book 2 in the Hand of Revenge series. It is not necessary to read book 1, Ace of Betrayal, but it may enhance the reading experience. This story may not be suitable for everyone. The Rise of Comfort Culture For a long time, fashion was often synonymous with formality and sometimes, discomfort. Think restrictive suits, sky-high heels, and fabrics that prioritized aesthetics over ease. â€‰ In the sports world, some wives and girlfriends are more famous than the athletes they are watching. Fashion brands have noticed. As Wimbledon was underway this week, with players adhering to the tournament's strict all-white dress code, fashion watchers turned their attention to the stands, where personalities like Morgan Riddle, the fashion influencer and girlfriend of the American tennis player Taylor Fritz, brought a slightly bolder look to the Grand Slam. On Monday, the tournament's first day, Ms. Riddle wore a blush pink mini dress by Patou, paired with matching strawberry-adorned mules (a nod to the tournament's well-known strawberry and cream dish) and a red Chanel purse. Her blond hair was tied into a half up, half down style with face-framing tendrils. ''If I dressed incredibly inappropriately for Wimbledon, it would be blasted on social media almost instantly and people would probably troll him for it,'' Ms. Riddle said in an interview, referring to Mr. Fritz. Her wardrobe teems with skirts, dresses, blazers and button-down shirts from brands like Thom Browne, Miu Miu and Burberry -- a far cry from her early days on tour with Mr. Fritz, whom she began a relationship with in 2020. Back then, Ms. Riddle, who did not grow up watching tennis, favored jeans, crop tops and sweatshirts. But as she became more enmeshed in the world of the elite sport, her style evolved to meet its expectations. While Wimbledon does not enforce a dress code for spectators, attendees are encouraged to dress ''smart.'' For men, that typically means tailored separates in muted tones; for women, sundresses and low heels. Ms. Riddle takes it a step further. She is polished from every angle, with every sartorial detail deliberate. That's partly because she is a WAG. The term WAG, an acronym used to refer to the wives and girlfriends of sports stars, gained popularity in the British tabloids in the early 2000s, when it was often attached to the glamorous partners of male soccer players. It reached a fever pitch during the 2006 World Cup, when figures like Victoria Beckham were covered almost as closely as the players themselves were. WAGs have taken on a second life in the American sports world, linked to basketball, football and, more recently, Formula 1 and tennis. Vogue called the summer, packed with the N.B.A. playoffs, the U.S. Open, the Stanley Cup and more, ''WAG season,'' spotlighting figures like Jordyn Woods, an influencer and the girlfriend of the Knicks star Karl-Anthony Towns as well as Kendall Murray, whose partner is Braiden McGregor of the New York Jets. Publications like Glamour published ''get the look'' edits inspired by Taylor Swift's game day outfits as she watched her boyfriend, Travis Kelce of the Kansas City Chiefs, play. Fashion brands have taken note. They're not just dressing the athletes anymore, but their partners, too -- for games, appearances and front rows. Reformation leaned in directly, debuting a collection last month designed for tennis spectators with the tagline: ''Those who can't play, watch.'' As interest in the styling choices of WAGs grows, the question becomes: What even is WAG style? Andrew Pokorny, a television producer who worked on ''WAGs Miami,'' a reality series from E! that aired in the mid-2010s, said that while there was not a singular look, most WAGs followed styling codes. For him, it comes down to one thing: projecting wealth. ''The bank account that they have access to, either through marriage or because they've been given beautiful gifts by their partners, does signal access to an elite club,'' Mr. Pokorny said. Bags from Louis Vuitton, HermÃ¨s and Fendi are mainstays, as are shoes from Christian Louboutin. But the illusion of wealth matters, too. According to Mr. Pokorny, many women on the show did not want to be seen in the same outfit twice, and they often worked with fast fashion companies like Fashion Nova to maintain the appearance of an endless wardrobe. In 2016, when the show was filming, that led to some flashy choices. But today's most visible WAGs opt for a more understated look. ''Whether it's ostentatious or subverted, it's always intentional,'' Mr. Pokorny said. '' These WAGs know that people are looking at them. It just depends on what's called for at the time.'' The performance of femininity is also crucial to WAG style, said Judy Liao, a professor at the University of Alberta who researches the sociology of sport and gender. In elite men's sports, women have traditionally been sidelined, seen by many as accessories helping to bolster their partner's masculinity rather than as ardent fans or active participants. What a WAG wears, and how she carries herself, can play a key role in that performance, Dr. Liao said. She sees the resurgence of the WAG as partly a pushback to the growing visibility of women's sports and of bodies that fall outside what she calls the Western ideal of femininity and heteronormativity. ''They're too strong, too Black or too queer,'' she said. '' That's still slightly challenging for the North American mainstream audience to really digest.'' ''WAGs really kind of offer the mainstream media this really good material to say, 'We support gender equality because we're showing women in sport,''' Dr. Liao added. '' But it's not the women who are actually playing the sports.'' Athletes themselves have noticed. In April, Daria Saville, the Australian professional tennis player, took to TikTok to express frustration over women tennis players being passed over for brand partnerships in favor of WAGs. Women who, she said, fit the tennis aesthetic that brands were profiting from. There has been, however, a growing trend of brands tapping women athletes for campaigns and endorsement deals. They include the W.N.B.A. player Angel Reese (Good American), the tennis star Coco Gauff (New Balance) and the rugby player Ilona Maher (Maybelline). But WAGs continue to thrive, with some developing larger social media followings than their partners. Sartorially, though, most roads lead back to the athlete. Dressing often becomes a form of fashion diplomacy, echoing the way political spouses represent their partners abroad....

â€‰ The beauty industry has evolved into one of the most dynamic and profitable sectors in the global economy. Fueled by innovation, celebrity endorsements, social media influence, and shifting consumer preferences toward skincare, sustainability, and inclusivity, cosmetics brands have grown into global powerhouses. While thousands of brands exist, only a few dominate the global market in terms of brand value, reach, and consumer loyalty. Here are the top 10 most valuable cosmetics brands in the world in 2025, based on market presence, revenue, brand equity, and global influence. 1. L'OrÃ©al (France) Estimated Brand Value: $12.5 Billion L'OrÃ©al remains the undisputed leader in the global cosmetics industry. With a presence in over 150 countries and a vast portfolio of sub-brands (including LancÃ´me, Maybelline, Kiehl's, and Garnier), L'OrÃ©al offers products for every skin type, budget, and beauty need. Their innovation in skincare, haircare, and makeup is unmatched, and the company continues to invest heavily in research and development. Their forward-thinking digital campaigns and sustainability initiatives â€” such as refillable packaging and green chemistry â€” have also strengthened their reputation among younger, eco-conscious consumers. 2. EstÃ©e Lauder (USA) Estimated Brand Value: $10.3 Billion EstÃ©e Lauder Companies owns a prestigious range of beauty brands, including MAC, Clinique, Bobbi Brown, La Mer, and Tom Ford Beauty. Known for luxurious skincare and elegant branding, EstÃ©e Lauder has secured a loyal base of affluent consumers worldwide. What sets them apart is their strength in high-end skincare and fragrances, and their aggressive push into emerging markets like China and India. Their digital transformation, especially during the pandemic, positioned them as a strong e-commerce player in the luxury beauty space. 3. NIVEA (Germany) Estimated Brand Value: $7.5 Billion Owned by Beiersdorf, NIVEA is a heritage brand with global recognition and trust. Known primarily for its skincare and body care products, NIVEA is especially dominant in Europe, Asia, and Latin America. While not a luxury brand, NIVEA's consistent quality and affordability give it massive global appeal. The brand has recently focused on developing sensitive skin-friendly formulations and expanding into men's grooming, increasing its reach across demographics. 4. Chanel (France) Estimated Brand Value: $6.8 Billion Chanel is the epitome of timeless luxury. Though more famous for fashion and fragrance, Chanel's cosmetics division â€” including foundations, lipsticks, and skincare â€” is among the most coveted in the world. The Chanel â„–5 perfume remains one of the best-selling fragrances globally. What elevates Chanel's value is exclusivity. Its limited product drops, premium pricing, and elegant in-store experiences ensure it remains aspirational and rarefied. 5. Dove (UK/USA) Estimated Brand Value: $6.2 Billion A Unilever brand, Dove is widely recognized for its inclusive, real-beauty approach. Famous for body washes, deodorants, and moisturizing products, Dove markets itself on self-esteem, confidence, and body positivity. Its messaging resonates strongly with Gen Z and millennials who favor authenticity over airbrushed perfection. Dove's initiatives such as the â€œReal Beauty Campaignâ€ and sustainability goals contribute significantly to its brand equity. 6. Clinique (USA) Estimated Brand Value: $5.7 Billion A subsidiary of EstÃ©e Lauder, Clinique is one of the pioneers of dermatologist-developed skincare. It's known for its â€œ3-Step Skin Care Systemâ€ and hypoallergenic, fragrance-free products. Clinique has successfully positioned itself at the intersection of clinical credibility and beauty, which appeals to consumers who are ingredient-conscious and result-driven. Its expansion into clean beauty and focus on men's skincare has kept it relevant in a fast-changing market. 7. Shiseido (Japan) Estimated Brand Value: $5.3 Billion...

â€‰ The Bridgerton actor gives us a masterclass in understated elegance with this timeless look Bridgerton star Hannah Dodd was a guest of honour at the Kit Kat Club in London this week to celebrate 1,500 performances of Cabaret. This prestigious occasion called for a look just as special, and the actor delivered with a killer beauty beat and ensembleâ€”all Chanel, of course. Hannah opted for a bouclÃ© blazer dress with jewel embellishments, modernised with a sheer tulle dress layered underneath, the eclectic look reminiscent of Carrie Bradshaw's '90s style. Her natural beauty look, comprised of her blonde hair styled in barely-there waves and radiant makeup, provided a softer contrast to the structured ensemble. The Bridgerton actor is currently staring alongside Rob Madge (star of My Son's a Queer But What Can You Do?) as leading role Sally Bowels in the West End show. The special performance at The Kit Kat Show marked the 1,500th performance of Cabaret. You may like We asked the actor about the inspiration behind her outfit, how she approached her makeup on the night and what her beauty rituals are when it comes to getting ready for a special occasion or event. Hannah's Chanel ensemble blends feminine and masculine styles (Image credit: Chanel/Hannah Dodd) Hannah's beauty look is quietly stunning, with a focus on radiant skin and a subtle emphasis on her features. Her eyes are gently lined with an eyeliner flick for an elegant cat eye, framed by natural, fluffy brows, while a sheer, blush pink lip complements her fair complexion. Hannah's makeup was fresh and radiant for the event (Image credit: Hannah Dodd/Chanel) "We focused on fresh, dewy, healthy skin," Hannah told us, crediting some Chanel beauty classics for her glowy makeup look. "We used the Chanel bronzing cream and the lip balm in peach," Hannah continued. "I love peach colours! And a flick on the eye for a fresh look." A flawless makeup look starts with a good base, a concept that skincare enthusiast Hannah champions. "I love skincare," she continued, before adding, "But I have to rein it in sometimes. I tend to overdo it with the active ingredients, so I have to keep it calm these days. Marie Claire Newsletter Celebrity news, beauty, fashion advice, and fascinating features, delivered straight to your inbox! By submitting your information you agree to the Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy and are aged 16 or over. Hannah credits her makeup looks to London-based makeup artist Sara Hill (Image credit: Hannah Dodd) "But taking my makeup off at the end of the day is a ritual that I absolutely love, especially now that I'm part of the show and wearing heavy makeup each day. It's become a way of disconnecting from the character and work and settling down." Hannah credits London-based makeup artist Sara Hill for her soft and dewy makeup look. "I'm very lucky to work with my makeup artist, Sara Hill, whom I have absolute faith and trust in. I love everything she does." Chanel's beauty range was used to create Hannah's look (Image credit: Chanel) Praising the power of a natural base, Hannah continued: "I love when your skin looks dewy, glowy. I have a few freckles, and I love it when they have the chance to show through!" The actor then added: "A fluffy brow, but with lips and eyes; I love experimenting depending on the event." And Hannah's must-have beauty products? "My desert Island products would be an SPF and a lip balm. When I'm going minimal, I just love brushing my eyebrows up, a little bit of concealer and curling my lashes is my absolute go-to!" Hannah Dodd wearing Chanel for a Cabaret Gala at the Kit Kat Club in London (Image credit: Hannah Dodd/Chanel) The French fashion house is, of course, known for its iconic suits, so it's no surprise that Hannah was dressed in a classic tweed jacket with the brand's signature sharp tailoring. Opting for a blazer dress instead of an evening gown held particular significance for the actor. "The suit is quite a symbol that's used throughout the show," Hannah told us. "I love tailoring anyway, but it felt like a really nice nod to the production." The perfect blend of Chanel's vintage and modern styling. Under the blazer, Hannah wore a tulle, floor-length dress underneath from Chanel's Fall/Winter 2024/25 ready-to-wear collection (Image credit: Hannah Dodd)...

â€‰ Top 10 highest paid actors in the world list: Big money and bigger names ruled 2024's box office and streaming charts. Nicole Kidman stands as the lone woman among the top 10 highest-paid actors in the world. List of highest-paid film actors in the world: Star power remains the backbone of the global film industry. Whether it's a billion-dollar franchise or a streaming-exclusive blockbuster, the actors fronting these projects often define their success, not just on screen, but at the box office and in brand boardrooms. Today's top actors are not just performers, they are business moguls, global influencers, and marketing giants whose earnings stretch far beyond traditional paychecks thanks to backend deals, endorsement empires, and their ability to draw crowds worldwide. From Hollywood heavyweights like , whose Fast & Furious and Jumanji franchises have raked in billions, to India's very own , who's reportedly commanding up to Rs 300 crore for the Pushpa phenomenon, star salaries are climbing to unprecedented heights. Even on a global scale, the dynamics are shifting: has now become the highest-grossing Hollywood actor ever, overtaking Marvel co-stars like Samuel L. Jackson and Robert Downey Jr., following the massive success of Jurassic World Rebirth. So, who's topping the charts when it comes to raw earnings in 2024? Here's a closer look at the top 10 highest paid actors in the world right now. Top 10 highest paid actors in the world 10. Will Smith Will Smith made a strong return with Bad Boys: Ride or Die, which crossed $1 billion worldwide. The film alone earned him $26 million, pushing his annual total to $30 million. The Oscar winner also profits from brand partnerships with Adobe, Insta360, and others, along with his work as a producer and entrepreneur. 9. Adam Sandler Sandler continued his run with Netflix, starring in titles like Spaceman and prepping Happy Gilmore 2. He pulled in $35 million this year, thanks to both new content and enduring popularity of his classics. Sandler also appears in campaigns for Pepsi, Subway, and several gaming brands. 8. Nicole Kidman The only woman on the list, Nicole Kidman tops all actresses with $41 million in gross earnings. She starred in hit series across Netflix, Amazon, and Paramount+, earning over $1 million per episode. She also headlined two romantic dramas â€“ A Family Affair and Babygirl â€“and remains active as a producer and voice actor. Also Read | 7. George Clooney Clooney reportedly earned $31 million for 's Wolfs, though some sources claim his fee neared $35 million. Known for his selective approach, Clooney typically signs on to a few high-profile, big- productions where he can negotiate premium deals, solidifying his status as one of the industry's top-earning and most bankable stars. 6. Brad Pitt Pitt earned a solid $42 million in 2024, driven largely by Wolfs and the highly anticipated F1 film, which released to massive fanfare in 2025. In addition to acting, Pitt's production company, Plan B, continued to back both commercial hits and award-season favourites, keeping him firmly in the industry spotlight. Off-screen, with lucrative endorsement deals from luxury and lifestyle giants like Chanel, Brioni, Heineken, and De'Longhi contributing significantly to his earnings. 5. Hugh Jackman Jackman's return as Wolverine in Deadpool & Wolverine earned him a reported $50 millionÂ his highest payday yet. This blockbuster reunion with Ryan Reynolds not only thrilled fans but also significantly boosted Jackman's position among the highest-paid actors globally. Beyond the screen, Jackman continues to diversify his portfolio: he's an established Broadway performer, a film producer, and a savvy businessman. His brand associations with Montblanc, R.M. Williams, and Micromax, alongside investments in stage musicals, reflect his wide-ranging creative and commercial pursuits that go far beyond traditional Hollywood stardom. 4. Jerry Seinfeld Seinfeld brought in $70 million over the past year, thanks largely to the enduring success of Seinfeld reruns. Beyond television, he remains a sought-after stand-up comedian, regularly performing live. He also ventured into filmmaking with Unfrosted on Netflix, which he directed and starred in. At 70, Seinfeld's commercial appeal shows no signs of slowing down. Also Read | 3. Kevin Hart...

â€‰ A story of visionary creativity that changed the way women dress. Coco Chanel as fearlessness, daring and risk, as well as taste, philosophy and brand. Mario Radachevsky's contemporary ballet about a woman who profoundly influenced the world of fashion. As a choreographer, he has in the past been fond of full-length titles inspired by the lives and works of great figures of human cultural history. We can recall the titles of ballets by Warhol, Beethoven, Michelangelo. Now his creative attention has been captured by an extraordinary woman who, by changing the wardrobe of the modern woman, has turned the world of fashion upside down. Her journey to the top, as it is with exceptional people, was painful, thorny, but for choreographer Mario Radachevsky the most important word of characterization is that she was real, genuine. In today's world, we often give up without a fight because it's easier, more comfortable. Many of our decisions are postponed because they arouse the need for self-denial. But the road to success knows no shortcuts. And the story of Coco Chanel can serve as an example and is proof of the importance of the endurance factor of determination and clear direction to go for your goal and be able to sacrifice and submit almost everything for success. The choreographer is fascinated by the reach of Coco Chanel's influence and significance, her ability to transform her field in such a way that we perceive with exaggeration the world of fashion before and after Chanel. As with most of his productions, MÃ¡rio RadaÄovskÃ½ work with his proven Slovak design team. Marek HollÃ½ will be the set designer and Ä½udmila VÃ¡rossovÃ¡ has accepted the tempting challenge of costume designin the spirit of Coco Chanel. â€‰ om Brady and Sofia Vergara are spending time together on a European summer vacation. The retired NFL star and the Modern Family actress were spotted hanging out on a celeb-filled outing aboard Ritz Carlton's new superyacht, Luminara, in Europe. An insider told Page Six, that Brady â€œasked to switch seats to sit next to her at dinner." Vergara shared a photo of the pair to her . In the snap, they're seated next to one another as J Balvin comes over to greet Vergara. The singer puts his arms around both of them and plants a kiss on the Griselda star's forehead as she laughs with her eyes closed and Brady smiles at the camera. TMZ reported that while the pair have been enjoying the trip together, they are not dating. Reps for both stars did not return PEOPLE's request for comment. Sofia Vergara/Instagram; Kevin Mazur/Getty The meeting occurred amid the luxury vessel's maiden voyage, a two-night journey for 400 guests that departed from Rome on July 1 for Malta, and culminated in a massive, star-studded party. Kendall Jenner, Patrick Schwarzenegger, Martha Stewart, Kate Hudson, Naomi Campbell and Brady's rumored former flame Irina Shayk, were among the other celebs reportedly on board. Page Six also reported that Vergara and Brady continued to hangout afterward in Ibiza, where he was also photographed on a yacht with Hudson and Dakota Johnson. Both Vergara and Brady are currently single. The sportscaster split from wife Gisele BÃ¼ndchen in 2022 after 13 years and was later linked to Shayk after they were photographed cozying upÂ in a car in 2023. Vergara split from husband Joe Mangianello in July 2023 after nine years together. She cheekily admitted she was looking for "a boyfriend...or a lover, maybe," at the 2025 Golden Globes in January. Brady and BÃ¼ndchen shareÂ son Benjamin, 14,Â andÂ daughter Vivian, 12,. He is also dad to son Jack, 17, with ex Bridget Moynahan. Vergara is mom to Manolo, 33, whom she shares with first husband Joe Gonzalez. Luminara is Ritz Carlton's third luxury yacht. The hotel brand launched Ilma and the Evrima last year. It features 226 luxury suites, all with balconies and 24/7 butler service. There's also five restaurants, Cartier and Chanel boutiques, and a spa on board.

Kendall Jenner, Patrick Schwarzenegger, Martha Stewart, Kate Hudson, Naomi Campbell and Brady's rumored former flame Irina Shayk, were among the other celebs reportedly on board. Page Six also reported that Vergara and Brady continued to hangout afterward in Ibiza, where he was also photographed on a yacht with Hudson and Dakota Johnson. Both Vergara and Brady are currently single. The sportscaster split from wife Gisele BÃ¼ndchen in 2022 after 13 years and was later linked to Shayk after they were photographed cozying up in a car in 2023. Vergara split from husband Joe Mangianello in July 2023 after nine years together. She cheekily admitted she was looking for "a boyfriend...or a lover, maybe," at the 2025 Golden Globes in January. Brady and BÃ¼ndchen share son Benjamin, 14, and daughter Vivian, 12,. He is also dad to son Jack, 17, with ex Bridget Moynahan. Vergara is mom to Manolo, 33, whom she shares with first husband Joe Gonzalez. Luminara is Ritz Carlton's third luxury yacht. The hotel brand launched Ilma and the Evrima last year. It features 226 luxury suites, all with balconies and 24/7 butler service. There's also five restaurants, Cartier and Chanel boutiques, and a spa on board. Read the original article on People

â€‰ Highest paid actors in the world List of highest-paid film actors in the world: Star power remains the backbone of the global film industry. Whether it's a billion-dollar franchise or a streaming-exclusive blockbuster, the actors fronting these projects often define their success, not just on screen, but at the box office and in brand boardrooms. Today's top actors are not just performers, they are business moguls, global influencers, and marketing giants whose earnings stretch far beyond traditional paychecks thanks to backend deals, endorsement empires, and their ability to draw crowds worldwide. From Hollywood heavyweights like Dwayne Johnson, whose Fast & Furious and Jumanji franchises have raked in billions, to India's very own Allu Arjun, who's reportedly commanding up to Rs 300 crore for the Pushpa phenomenon, star salaries are climbing to unprecedented heights. Even on a global scale, the dynamics are shifting: Scarlett Johansson has now become the highest-grossing Hollywood actor ever, overtaking Marvel co-stars like Samuel L. Jackson and Robert Downey Jr., following the massive success of Jurassic World Rebirth. So, who's topping the charts when it comes to raw earnings in 2024? Here's a closer look at the top 10 highest paid actors in the world right now. Top 10 highest paid actors in the world Rank Highest-paid Actor Earnings (in $ million) 1. Dwayne Johnson 88 2. Ryan Reynolds 85 3. Kevin Hart 81 4. Jerry Seinfeld 60 5. Hugh Jackman 50 6. Brad Pitt 32 7. George Clooney 31 8. Nicole Kidman 31 9. Adam Sandler 26 10. Will Smith 26 Source: Forbes Will Smith made a strong return with Bad Boys: Ride or Die, which crossed $1 billion worldwide. The film alone earned him $26 million, pushing his annual total to $30 million. The Oscar winner also profits from brand partnerships with Adobe, Insta360, and others, along with his work as a producer and entrepreneur. Sandler continued his run with Netflix, starring in titles like Spaceman and prepping Happy Gilmore 2. He pulled in $35 million this year, thanks to both new content and enduring popularity of his classics. Sandler also appears in campaigns for Pepsi, Subway, and several gaming brands. The only woman on the list, Nicole Kidman tops all actresses with $41 million in gross earnings. She starred in hit series across Netflix, Amazon, and Paramount+, earning over $1 million per episode. She also headlined two romantic dramas â€“ A Family Affair and Babygirl â€“and remains active as a producer and voice actor. Also Read George Clooney (AP) Clooney reportedly earned $31 million for Apple's Wolfs, though some sources claim his fee neared $35 million. Known for his selective approach, Clooney typically signs on to a few high-profile, big-budget productions where he can negotiate premium deals, solidifying his status as one of the industry's top-earning and most bankable stars. Brad Pitt as Sonny Hayes in F1: The Movie (Warner Bros. Pictures) Pitt earned a solid $42 million in 2024, driven largely by Wolfs and the highly anticipated F1 film, which released to massive fanfare in 2025. In addition to acting, Pitt's production company, Plan B, continued to back both commercial hits and award-season favourites, keeping him firmly in the industry spotlight. Off-screen, with lucrative endorsement deals from luxury and lifestyle giants like Chanel, Brioni, Heineken, and De'Longhi contributing significantly to his earnings. Jackman's return as Wolverine in Deadpool & Wolverine earned him a reported $50 millionâ€”his highest payday yet. This blockbuster reunion with Ryan Reynolds not only thrilled fans but also significantly boosted Jackman's position among the highest-paid actors globally. Beyond the screen, Jackman continues to diversify his portfolio: he's an established Broadway performer, a film producer, and a savvy businessman. His brand associations with Montblanc, R.M. Williams, and Micromax, alongside investments in stage musicals, reflect his wide-ranging creative and commercial pursuits that go far beyond traditional Hollywood stardom. Seinfeld brought in $70 million over the past year, thanks largely to the enduring success of Seinfeld reruns. Beyond television, he remains a sought-after stand-up comedian, regularly performing live. He also ventured into filmmaking with Unfrosted on Netflix, which he directed and starred in. At 70, Seinfeld's commercial appeal shows no signs of slowing down. Also Read Hart earned a staggering $108 million, placing him among the top-earning actors globally. Known for his dynamic presence as a comedian, TV producer, and voice actor, Hart headlined several major projects across streaming platforms like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Peacock, and Roku. Beyond acting, he remained active in the stand-up comedy circuit, hosted popular podcasts, and served as the face of major brand campaigns for companies such as DraftKings and Chase. Reynolds brought in an impressive $100 million from Deadpool & Wolverine, where he was actor, producer, and co-writer. His creative imprint extended beyond the screen through his marketing company, Maximum Effort, which played a key role in the film's marketing success and contributed to its billion-dollar box office run....

â€‰ NEED TO KNOW Emily Simpson says her son Luke has been diagnosed with ARFID, a mental health disorder in which someone severely avoids or restricts food intake She said the 10-year-old refuses to eat most foods because he gets very overwhelmed by texture, color and smells The RHOC star tells PEOPLE it's been challenging for her family to learn how to navigate Luke's eating disorder Parenthood has been a challenge lately for Emily Simpson, whose son was recently diagnosed with an eating disorder. The Real Housewives of Orange County star tells PEOPLE exclusively that she'd always assumed her son Luke, 10, was just a picky eater, like many young kids. But when it got to the point that he was refusing to eat anything, she decided to take him to a therapist. Soon after, Luke was diagnosed with ARFID, a mental health disorder in which someone avoids or restricts food intake. Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID) can cause someone to lose interest in eating, avoid foods that have an unwanted color, texture, taste or smell, and feel fear or anxiety about food or the consequences of eating, like choking or vomiting, according to the Cleveland Clinic. Unlike anorexia, bulimia, or other forms of disordered eating, ARFID isn't â€œcaused by a negative self-image or a desire to change your body weight." Simpson, 49, shares more details: â€œHe only eats a few different foods and he's very overwhelmed by texture, color, smells. He will only eat white rice. And he has to inspect each piece of rice before he eats it. So it's beyond picky eating. A lot of control issues. It's very overwhelming.â€ The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now! Emily Simpson Emily Simpson with her son Luke Never miss a story â€” sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offerâ€‹â€‹, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. â€œThere were so many times when he would say he was starvingâ€¦ because he was starving. But he would refuse to eat. And as a mom, that was so frustrating. I didn't know what to do because on one hand he's crying and telling me he's starving, and on the other hand, he refuses to eat anything that I offer,â€ she explains. â€œEvery day is challenging.â€ The reality star says fans will see her face Luke's diagnosis in real time, since it happened while she was filming season 19 of RHOC. More in Celebrity â€œThere were lots of times I didn't even know if I could continue to film,â€ she says. â€œ[Husband] Shane and I are learning every day how to navigate it.â€ During production, Simpson says she was very overwhelmed and lost in Luke's diagnosis, even feeling at odds with Shane over how to approach it. Emily Simpson Emily Simpson with her twin sons Luke and Keller The couple eventually started therapy, which has helped them learn how to adjust and parent Luke differently than their other four children: son Keller, 10, daughter Annabelle, 12, and Shane's daughters from his first marriage â€” Chanel, 19, and Shelby, 24. Treatment for ARFID typically involves cognitive behavioral therapy to help someone lessen fear or anxiety around food and become more comfortable with sensory challenges. In some cases, providers may prescribe medications to stimulate the patient's appetite or even provide a temporary feeding tube to ensure proper nutrition. Luke is currently in therapy and working with a nutritionist. Simpson says. These days he's comfortable eating rice, french fries, sliced bananas, potato chips, ice cream and plain turkey that â€œdoesn't have any lines or blemishes in it.â€ She admits it's not easy to add new foods to his diet but she doesn't want to make him feel bad. "I try to put myself in his shoes and in his head, and for him, everything is different than the way we see it. Smells are extremely overwhelming for him. Color is overwhelming for him. Textures of food are overwhelming and make him gag. So I have to constantly remind myself that he doesn't operate neurologically like we do.â€ Additionally, Luke now wears nose inserts with essential oils on them to mask the smells of overwhelming foods. While Simpson says Luke is "a lot better now,â€ she worries about what will happen when he returns to school and she starts filming again, and they're not together all the time. She also expresses concern that other kids and parents at his school will say something about his diagnosis after watching the latest season of the Bravo show. But she's trying to stay positive about being transparent....

â€‰ Singapore-based boutique hotel portfolio set for growth with digital real estate investment in partnership with Cendyn. Cendyn, a global integrated hotel technology and services company, is delighted to announce a partnership with Singapore-based boutique hospitality company â€“ Naumi Hotels â€“ as it prepares for expansion with a brand refresh and investment in its digital real estate. Marking 18 years since the opening of its flagship Naumi Hotel Singapore, Naumi is launching a new website and promotional campaign accompanied by new visuals to drive home the USP of design-led boutique properties. With seven hotels in Singapore, New Zealand, and Australia, the boutique hotel portfolio is set to continue its international expansion in 2025 â€“ bringing the Naumi experience to new destinations around the world. Naumi will benefit from Cendyn Web services enabling the brand to come to life through design-led digital visual experiences. The boutique hospitality portfolio will be able to leverage first-party data from various sources, including the booking engine and stay data, to optimize user experiences. By fully showcasing its unique hotel story on a fully customized and immersive branded digital experience, advanced personalization will give Naumi Hotels the ability to tailor content, offers, and imagery to audience preferences, assisting in driving direct bookings and overall visitor satisfaction. â€œWe have reached a point where the digital experience needs to reflect the stay experience,â€ said Group COO, Paul Stocker, Naumi Hotels. â€œWe want to bring our bold brand to life online. Cendyn's design sensibility and technical execution along with the intuitive and user-centric CMS platform was a major factor in our decision. Not only does Cendyn provide essential data security, but it empowers our team with seamless content control without compromising on design or functionality. â€œWe were looking for a partner that could grow with us. Cendyn's platform gives us the flexibility and scalability we need to support our continued expansion across key markets. We've been incredibly impressed by the level of account support and customer services the team has received.â€ â€œNaumi Hotels can now communicate its distinctive, design-led identity and unique guest experiences through its digital asset â€“ this was clearly necessary and timely for the brand,â€ said Rick Posey, Senior Director, Reporting & Analytics â€“ eCommerce, Cendyn. â€œThe team can now better collaborate across the portfolio by giving each property access to make website updates for the menu, F&B promotions, campaigns, operating hours etc while allowing the central team to review and publish. Naumi will be able to drive more direct bookings with special packages and personalized experiences at every stage of the guest journey.â€ Founded in 2007, Naumi blends bold design with personal, heartfelt service for immersive stays tailored to the modern traveler where rooms are inspired by influential cultural phenomena including Madonna, Coco Chanel, and Andy Warhol. Built around the idea of creating unforgettable memories for every guest and inspired by the principles of individuality, design innovation, and impeccable service, the brand embodies a philosophy of making every stay bespoke and extraordinary. Naumi Hotels plans to roll out the new website and brand identity in September ahead of its 18th anniversary of the opening of the 73-room flagship hotel, located in Singapore's vibrant city center. For more information discover Cendyn's Web packages offering.

â€‰ Dillinja got his sound by slamming the inputs on his dat recorder. They're digital but it worked. Pretty sure the channels on ableton don't clip. But what does clip is a bunch of Chanel's clipping then hitting the master and clipping that too. I've also noticed bad kind of clipping between plugins if they're clipping their output. Anyway - long story short - I've heard ableton clip in a bad way. So I always gain stage everything to 0 then have the faders around -6. If it clips the master I just turn that down 3db too. Gain staging to zero means you get accurate results within channels at the plugins. A signal hitting the compressor for eg will come in at 0 so you know when you turn the threshold down to -15 it's actually -15 into the signal you want to compress. If that makes sense. Gain staging

Click: Luxury Meets Responsibility: Sustainability Transforms the Jewelry Landscape Sustainability is rapidly becoming a central focus in the global jewelry industry, as consumers demand greater environmental and ethical accountability. Shoppers now prioritize materials like recycled metals, lab-grown diamonds, and ethically sourced gemstones, while also valuing circular design, favoring products that are repairable, recyclable, or upcycled. Leading brands are responding. In 2023, Tiffany & Co. expanded its sustainability initiatives by aligning with LVMH's Code of Conduct, adopting renewable energy, and launching eco-conscious efforts like Love for Our Oceans. Meanwhile, Prada's 2022 Eternal Gold collection introduced high jewelry made entirely from 100% recycled gold. As consumer expectations evolve, sustainability is becoming a key factor in product innovation and brand loyalty across the luxury jewelry market. Signet Strengthens Global Design and Supply Capabilities (2024): Signet continued to drive innovation by aligning with global design trends and launching new collections through strategic partnerships. AI-Driven Jewelry Market: Redefining Design, Operations, and Customer Experience at Scale The North American jewelry market is embracing a quiet revolution and it's powered by AI. From how designs are imagined to how customers shop, artificial intelligence is bringing speed, personalization, and a new layer of creativity to the industry. Designers are now using AI to create unique pieces tailored to customer preferences. These smart tools analyze trends, past purchases, and style data to generate designs that feel both fresh and personal. In 2024, the NEW VERTU AI Ring launched as a standout example, blending luxury design with smart features like heart rate and sleep tracking. AI is also helping brands move faster. In 2023, Pandora teamed up with o9 Solutions to bring AI into its planning process making it easier to predict demand, manage inventory, and respond to what customers want in real time. Personalization is another key frontier. AI-powered customization tools allow consumers to co-create pieces based on individual taste, budget, and style making the jewelry buying journey more interactive, efficient, and emotionally resonant. Consumer Preferences: A Shift Toward Experience, Personalization, and Purpose Experience over ownership: Millennials and Gen Z favor meaningful brand interactions, such as exclusive events and storytelling. Customization matters: Consumers seek personalized options like engraving to reflect individuality. Digital-first journey: Virtual try-ons and AR tools are now standard expectations. Sustainability-focused: Ethical sourcing and transparent practices are essential. Heritage appeal: Premium buyers still value rare metals and artisanal design. Influencer impact: Celebrity collaborations shape trend adoption. Luxury as identity: Rising incomes continue to drive demand for high-end pieces. Virtual Try-On Tech Gains Traction in North American Jewelry Market Virtual try-on technology is redefining how consumers shop for jewelry online, combining real-time rendering, 3D visualization, and hand or face tracking to deliver a more confident and personalized shopping experience. By allowing customers to preview pieces before purchase, virtual try-ons are reducing hesitation and driving higher conversion rates. Brands like Pandora and Kendra Scott are already seeing results, reporting improved customer satisfaction and stronger digital sales. As AI and machine learning enhance personalization, and 3D imaging sharpens realism, virtual try-ons are fast becoming a strategic growth driver across North America's digital jewelry market. While the sequence was certainly awkward and more than a little shady, Michael Kors bags are nothing to turn your nose up at; Katie Holmes, Emma Roberts, Rachel Brosnahan and Kerry Washington have all carried the brand's purses over the years. And it couldn't be a better time to pick up a Kors bag of your own; along with a slew of other celebrity-worn styles, they're deeply discounted during Amazon Prime Day. We're talking up to 57% off! Below, a selection of standouts sure to earn you compliments â€”Â yes, really! Michael Kors It's giving Chanel, if you ask us. Available in eight colors, this one is a day-to-night leather beauty that shoppers say is â€œeven prettier in person.â€ Michael Kors This 50%-off small tote is a great everyday bag that comes in so many pretty colors. One five-star review says it's a â€œgorgeous bag,â€ with most shoppers enjoying the metal accents. Michael Kors Available in over 20 colors, this chic satchel has a top handle and removable cross-body strap, so you can wear it two ways. It's also available in a gorgeous woven pattern. Michael Kors The signature Michael Kors logo-print canvas is iconic for a reason. This zip-top satchel can also be worn with or without the cross-body strap and has pretty metal accents. Michael Kors This everyday, easy-to-wear slouchy hobo also comes in rich brown. Besides the spacious main compartment, it has two easy-to-reach zip pockets on the front. Michael Kors The handbag with just the right amount of handle to slide onto your arm comfortably, this style has a lined interior with lots of convenient pockets. Michael Kors Logo lovers unite around this adorable wristlet that's on sale for less than dinner for two. (It also comes in plenty of solid colors.) Michael Kors Made from Saffiano leather, this streamlined bag says quiet luxe. Michael Kors â€œThis is a beautiful handbag. Not too large, but large enough to hold my essentials,â€ raved one review, while another echoed the sentiment with, â€œAbsolutely love this.â€ Michael Kors A sleek messenger style which holds an iPad and book for wherever your travels may take you. Prime Day FAQs, answered When is Prime Day 2025? For the first time this year, Prime Day will span 4 days! Sales begin on July 8 at 12:01 a.m. PT and runs through July 11 at 11:59 p.m. PT. When does Prime Day end? Calling all chronic procrastinators: Prime Day 2025 ends on July 11 at 11:59 p.m. PT. Do you have to be a Prime member to shop Prime Day? Prime Day is Amazon's member-exclusive sale event. You can get a 30-day free trial to enjoy Prime Day savings (plus all the benefits of the subscription) with no strings attached. Do Prime Day deals change? Yes, Prime Day deals change throughout the day and all week, so act fast when you see a good deal! Amazon may drop already-low prices, and also includes Lightning Deals that last just hours â€” or until stock sells out. What deals are worth shopping during Prime Day?...

â€‰ I would start out by calling every supplier representative who will answer the phone. Tell them you are starting out and trying to understand the quality, concentration, and ingredients of perfume oils before making a purchase. Take notes. The industry must have a general way of describing what they have. There is probably quite a bit of puffery, but the more knowledgeable you are, the more you will be able to narrow down what you need. I have learned a lot by keeping things open-ended and letting a vendor educate me. I've made the mistake of asking questions that are too specific, and due to my lack of knowledge, I didn't get the whole picture. You can start broad and then drill down. I would also ask if they provide samples. You can't buy without knowing if it smells good. Just because you think it smells good doesn't mean other people will like it, so get friends, family, or pay people $5 on the sidewalk for their opinion. Also, try r/fragrance and r/perfumery They are probably snobby but filter through the nonsense, and you should get a consensus on standards, recommended suppliers, etc. You can Google each subreddit with a keyword and find things as well as the Reddit search. I lived in Australia for about 3 years and had a business selling high volumes of cheap perfume. One time, I counterfeited a bunch of Chanel perfume with nice packaging. I ordered plain bottles filled with a Chanel clone, then put on embossed Chanel stickers. I had packaging as well. The Chinese immigrant packaging suppliers only cared about the fact that I paid in cash, lol. I rented a nice convertible and put magnetic Chanel stickers on it. I sold that stuff in flea markets with the "Chanelmobile" parked in the stall with ribbons and bows. The ladies loved it, and nobody ever returned it or complained. That was over 30 years ago when I was a young man hustling my way around the globe, pillaging as I traveled. The difference between a quality perfume and crap is obvious to me after selling so much of it, but the average person is pretty clueless. I've sold an unbelievable amount of stinky garbage. That's Australia. Other places might be different. They had high tariffs on imported goods, so they were expensive, and the country is isolated. Also, a bit redneck in their own way. Also, you might need r/packaging and a Chinese liquid filling machine off Amazon for less than $100. Unless you're planning on really cranking out product, a cheap machine will get you started. You probably already know this. Also, if you're going to print on bottles, use a Chinese pad printer and a cheap compressor. There are YouTube videos on the process, and suppliers will educate you and sell you a printing plate, ink, solvent, and silicone pad. Also, buy a small scale off Amazon for measuring the ink. It's a cheap and easy process, and you can get a Chinese pad printer off Amazon for a few hundred dollars. That's a lot more than you asked for, I hope it helps. Feel free to ask questions. Good luck in your endeavor.
