â€‰ The Macallan has officially opened its first Shop-in-Shop (SIS) in Brazil at SÃ£o Paulo Guarulhos International Airport ( GRU ), Terminal 3, International Departures, in partnership with Avolta. The GRU location is the single malt Scotch whisky's second SIS in Latin America, following its debut in Panama in 2023, and expands its footprint in Latin America to the busiest and most important airport in the region. Situated alongside renowned brands such as Chanel, Dior and Lancome, the new SÃ£o Paulo SIS positions The Macallan at the heart of the airport's curated luxury environment. â€œThe opening of The Macallan Shop-in-Shop in SÃ£o Paulo marks a significant milestone in our Latin American journey. Guarulhos International Airport is a critical gateway, connecting millions of travelers each year, and this new space brings The Macallan's story and craftsmanship to life for a wider audience. By partnering with Avolta, a driving force in Americas travel retail, we are able to offer an elevated retail experience that showcases our commitment to innovation and prestige within the channel. This launch further cements our presence in the region and reflects our vision to bring the very best of The Macallan to both loyal collectors and those discovering our brand for the first time,â€ says Kasper Andersen, Regional Managing Director â€“ Global Travel Retail at Edrington. Every design detail of the SÃ£o Paulo SIS captures the essence of the brand's natural creativity and craftsmanship, says the company. The interior features a bold red backdrop showcasing the prestige range along with a transparent LED facade, designed to capture travelers' attention and draw them into the space. Inside, an integrated multi-sensory and digital experience brings to life the heart of The Macallan's whisky-making traditions. The design draws inspiration from the brand's Six Pillars â€“ unique elements that define The Macallan's craft and character. Through a blend of engaging visuals, interactive digital features, and opportunities to sample different expressions, travelers are invited to discover what makes The Macallan distinctive, from the iconic stills and oak casks to the natural color, sherry cask maturation, meticulous attention to quality, and the brand's roots in Speyside. Shoppers can interact with the prominent Six Pillars display at the front of the space and explore further with digital tools including the â€œDiscover Your Expression tool, helping each visitor find the whisky best suited to their tastes. The Sao Paolo SIS also showcases a curated selection of The Macallan's single malts, including exclusive and limited releases only available in The Macallan Shop-in-Shops, as well as the travel-exclusive Colour Collection. Highly trained instore brand ambassadors are present to guide shoppers through the various bottlings on offer to discover expressions that suit their individual taste, while a range of personalized gifting services is offered. Wilcy Wong, Commercial Directorâ€“ Global Travel Retail at Edrington, added: â€œLatin America is a key focus for us at The Macallan, and we're excited to see our first Shop-in-Shop in Brazil open at SÃ£o Paulo Guarulhos International Airport. This launch reflects the strong collaboration with our partners and our shared commitment to creating meaningful experiences for travellers. We're looking forward to welcoming guests and giving them the opportunity to explore our rare expressions, personalized services, and the craftsmanship behind every bottle.â€ â€œWe are delighted to strengthen our partnership with The Macallan through the launch of this first-ever Shop-in-Shop in Brazil at Guarulhos International Airport. By combining The Macallan's heritage and prestige with Avolta's bold approach to retail, we are able to deliver a benchmark luxury spirits experience, taking us one step further in our mission to revolutionize the traveler's journey, â€ says Gustavo Fagundes, Managing Director Brazil at Avolta. The post appeared first on Duty Fre

â€‰ Legacy, Love & A Sparkling Yes â€” Will Peltz and Kenya Kinski-Jones Are Officially Engaged In a year full of breakups, breakdowns, and broken PR statements, here comes a love story that feels like a sigh of relief. Yes, this is what romance looks like in real lifeâ€”if your real life just happens to come with red carpets, billion-dollar legacies, and more iconic last names than an awards ceremony guest list. HOLLYWOOD, CALIFORNIA â€“ AUGUST 11: Kenya Kinski-Jones and Will Peltz attend Variety's 2022 Power of Young Hollywood celebration presented by Facebook Gaming on August 11, 2022 in Hollywood, California. (Photo by Axelle/Bauer-Griffin/FilmMagic) Will Peltz , 39, and Kenya Kinski-Jones , 32, are officially engagedâ€”and the internet is glowing almost as much as that ring. The pair, who've been together for more than a decade , announced their engagement in a black-and-white Instagram post that immediately had celebrity friends (and fans) flooding the comments. In the photo, Kenya gently kisses Will on the cheek, her dazzling diamond on full display, while the caption reads simply: â€œJUST ENGAGED My whole heart for my whole life. â€ Cue the collective awww. A Romance Rooted in Legacy For those just tuning in: this is no ordinary couple. Kenya is the youngest daughter of music legend Quincy Jones , who passed away in late 2024 at age 91, and acclaimed actress Nastassja Kinski . Her timeless beauty and effortless style have made her a quiet but powerful presence in the fashion world. She's walked for Stella McCartney, Calvin Klein, and Chanel, but she's also known for being fiercely private â€”which makes this public celebration of love all the more special. Will, on the other hand, is the son of billionaire businessman Nelson Peltz and former model Claudia Heffner Peltz â€”a family known for its high-profile connections and close-knit bond. His sister, Nicola Peltz Beckham , famously married Brooklyn Beckham , cementing the Peltzes' place in modern Hollywood royalty. Nicola wasted no time posting her excitement online, writing: â€œKENYA JONES PELTZ MY FOREVER SISTER!!!! IM SO HAPPY I LOVE YOU BOTH â€ Talk about family goals. A Decade in the Making Kenya and Will's love story didn't begin in the headlines. They've been soft-launching their relationship long before it was a trendâ€”sharing quiet anniversary posts, snapshots of beach days, and cozy behind-the-scenes moments. In April 2020, Kenya shared a rare and heartfelt tribute on their ninth anniversary: â€œ9 years! â€¦ My heart and best friend, I more than love you and I always will. You felt like home since the first day.â€ Their story proves that even in the whirlwind of fame and family legacies, genuine connection still mattersâ€”and can last. A Star-Studded Seal of Approval Within hours of the announcement, the comments section of Kenya's post read like a red carpet guest list: Paris Jackson : â€œyes â€ Sophia Stallone : â€œyay!! congratulations you twoâ€ Laura Harrier dropped heart emojis. Even a few fashion designers chimed in with custom engagement emojis (yes, that's a thing now). Meanwhile, Will also shared his own emotional tribute to Kenya's late father shortly after his passing, calling Quincy â€œa guiding lightâ€ and â€œa reminder that true greatness is measured not just by talent, but by love.â€ What's Next? While there's no word yet on a wedding date (or if it'll be held on the Beckham estate or somewhere more low-key), fans are already buzzing about the dress, the guest list, andâ€”let's be honestâ€”the possibility of a Vogue spread. But for now, it's enough to just celebrate the moment. A decade of love, a lifetime ahead, and a reminder that sometimes, the best love stories are the ones built slowly, quietly, and with intention. Here's to Will and Kenyaâ€”legacy kids, lovers, and now, fiancÃ©s. Tags Â· kenya jonesÂ·quincy jones

â€‰ While a white shirt with a black bikini will always be a timeless beach combination, this year there has been a return to extravagant â€“Â possibly bordering on obnoxious? â€“Â resortwear. Instead of dressing as though they holiday like you and me, celebrities are embracing an opulent Euro aesthetic that cackles in the face of quiet luxury and puts the fun back into the vacation wardrobe. It was April when declared that the Pucci Woman would define the 2025 vibe: fast forward to this week, and Hailey Bieber was dressed like a human shot of limoncello in Port d'Andratx, wearing a zesty custom capri-pant-and-string-bikini set by the Italian brand, and a pair of kitten heels for good measure. If the quiet luxury movement was all about an Olsen twin-inspired, anti-paparazzi approach to dressing, this is the total opposite: think, leaning into look-at-me style tropes. Having a dedicated resortwear wardrobe is in itself an extravagance (a sign that you spend a chunk of the year out of office without a second thought for your annual leave allowance). Swirl print palazzos, tunics and pool-ready co-ords aren't ever going to translate into your everyday wardrobe. Unless, that is, you actually live in Portofino. Celebrities have levelled up their swimwear game specifically this year, via custom resortwear creations â€“ like Hailey Bieber's Pucci set â€“ and rare archive looks. Kylie Jenner, for example, has worn a rhinestone-encrusted Chanel bikini from the spring/summer 1995 collection a polka-dot set from Ralph Lauren's spring/summer 2000 collection. There's nothing frugal about this particular second-hand swimwear: both sets are considered collector's items. You can embrace Amalfi styling without blowing four figures on a bikini, however. Simply seek out bold colours, printed scarves and sarongs (if you can stretch to Pucci, then do so), and embellished swimwear. One note of caution: this look really requires a Med backdrop â€“ your local lido won't cut it. Extra embellishment: For her recent holiday to Mallorca, Dua Lipa amped up the glamour in a sequin-encrusted kaftan and a cheery-embellished bikini from the recent Frankies Bikinis X RÃ©alisation Par collaboration. She also boarded a yacht in a teeny-tiny leopard-print bikini with a gold Chanel quilted bag â€“ the Euro vacay girl doesn't mess around with practical things like raffia. Frankies Bikinis X RÃ©alisation Par Nick Triangle Bikini Top Frankies Bikinis X RÃ©alisation Par Mackenzie Bikini Bottom Double or triple polka dots: In Italy, Kylie Jenner wore a polka-dot bikini and matching capri pants from Ralph Lauren's spring/summer 2000 collection. The Kardashian-Jenners have never really messed with shy-and-retiring minimalism, and she's been summering this year in leopard print, studded and spotty swimwear. It's all very vintage Dolce (sorry, Kourtney). Sir Devin Polka-Dot Bikini Top Dolce & Gabbana Cotton Pants With Polka-Dot Print Football fever: Model Paloma Elsesser took to the beach in Barcelona toting an oversized Balenciaga City bag (a fashion-girl pool bag) and wearing a vintage football print co-ord. She proves that summer can be a time for loud prints and a more literal take on Euros dressing (after all, it is the summer of women's football). Conner Ives Printed Shirred Jersey Top Conner Ives AppliquÃ©d Lace-Trimmed Striped Shorts Pucci prints: For a Rhode party in Mallorca to celebrate the launch of her lemon-scented lip balm, Hailey dressed on-theme in a â€œlemontiniâ€ look that matched her cocktail. Her stylist Dani Michelle worked on this custom Pucci capri and bikini set, which features a zesty twist on the brand's iconic Iride print. For a boat trip, she then added a polka dot scarf to her hair to make the whole thing even more Euro summer. Pucci Iride Printed Swimsuit Pucci Iride Printed Silk Miniskirt La Dolce Vita scarves: Alexa Chung embraced the retro vibe of Positano in her bright red high-waisted shorts, which she styled with a clashing purple top and a printed scarf looped over her hair. It's nostalgic Italian glamour at its very best, and let's be honest, beats a plain black bikini any day. Pucci Marmo Silk Twill Scarf Cou Cou Intimates...

â€‰ After Demna Gvasalia's farewell show for Balenciaga, the Haute Couture Week opened new perspectives in Paris. The autumn/winter collections 2025/2026 showed a fashion that combines craft and technology. Upcycling was cheerfully celebrated by Glenn Martens for Maison Margiela and Germanier. Ronald van der Kemp and Iris van Herpen focused on respect for nature. Of course, the absences of well -known designers also noticed during this fashion week: inside, which was also caused by the chair in the large fashion houses. For example, Jonathan Anderson shows his first Haute-Couture collection for Dior in January 2026, after he already presented his first menswear collection this month. Duran Lantink starts Beijean Paul Gaultier with the Womenswear collection in September 2026. This marked the end of the guest designer model and the return to PrÃªt-Ã -porter collections. Pierpaolo Piccioli at Valentino as well as French houses such as Alexis Mabille and Julien FourniÃ© were also missing. Chanel showed a collection, but not under the leadership of the new creative chief matthieu Blazy, who only made his debut in October during the Paris Fashion Week. The current collection was the last of the internal design studio. Balenciaga: Demna Gvasalia completely before moving to Gucci Balenciaga Couture 2025 Credits: Â© Launchmetrics/Spotlight Speaking of the last show. Demna Gvasalia's farewell to Balenciaga took place in the historical salons of the house on Avenue George V in Paris. The rush was great. Numerous stars like Aya Nakamura, Katy Perry, Nicole Kidman, Lauren SÃ¡nchez Bezos and Cardi B were in the front row. Kim Kardashian, Isabelle Huppert and Naomi Campbell ran over the catwalk himself. The show music announced the names of the employees: inside. In the end, the name was called, followed by Sades 'No Ordinary Love'. A reflection of his extraordinary fashion. The show presented its characteristic designs. These could also be seen in the exhibition dedicated to him: women's costumes with oversized shoulders, structured couture dresses, oversized men jackets and a tribute to Elizabeth Taylor's nightgown from the film 'The cat on the hot tin roof' for Kim Kardashian. Kim Kardashian for Balenciaga Couture 2025 Credits: Â© Launchmetrics/Spotlight However, there was a little reference to his streetwear preference that was missing in the show. Gvasalia showed itself in a black hoodie, an extra -wide trousers with a military print and a cap. According to 'The Cut', he said backstage: â€œIn hoodie, jeans and baseball cap, I feel like it was outâ€. A clever hint that everything will change with his position as a designer at Gucci. Its first show has been announced for March 2026. Maison Margiela and Germanier: The future of fashion is upcycling Glenn Martens' first collection 'Artisanal', the name of the couture line of the house, embodied the connection between Couture and Street Culture. As a tribute to Martin Margiela, the founder of the brand of the same name, the new creative director presented his collection in the Centquatre in Paris. Martin Margiela had held his last show there. Maison Margiela HW25 Credits: Maison Margiela Martens picked up the DNA of the house: recycling, upcycling, anonymity and misuse of objects. He chose a decor of torn wallpapers. He covered the faces of the models with masks made of crushed metal cans, paint paper and illusion tulle. The looks were created from crumpled plastic bags. An impressive golden dress was made from recycled computer cables. Look 10: Dress with draped, heart -shaped skirt made of golden, fabric woven with metal threads. Credits: Maison Margiela Glenn Martens showed that Couture can pave the way to develop towards a new, more ecological and ethical fashion production. The future of fashion is the ability of the fashion houses to adapt to the remaining natural resources. The couture plays an important role in this because it is manual, experimentally and artistically oriented. Recycling is also the strength of the Swiss designer Kevin Germanier. He told fashionunited: â€œOn the day my couture no longer consists of recycled materials, it is no longer worth visiting my showsâ€. The press release says about his collection 'Les Joueuses': â€œWe live in a difficult time: political, socially, economical. My job is to bring light, and that drives my work. This collection is a direct answer. I wanted joy on the catwalkâ€....

â€‰ Dree Hemingway has seemingly been cast as Daryl Hannah in the upcoming Ryan Murphy seriesÂ American Love Story. Rumors of her casting began after she was spotted filming a kissing scene with Paul Kelly, who's portraying John F. Kennedy Jr. in the show. Kennedy and Hannah met in the early 1980s when their families were both vacationing in Saint Martin. However, it wasn't until 1988 that they reconnected at a wedding. At some point after the wedding, they began dating. They were together on-and-off until they split in 1994. American Love Story will mostly focus on Kennedy's relationship with Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy, whom he started dating (and eventually married) after his split from Hannah. However, it appears the show will also touch on at least one of his prior relationships, which is where Dree's character comes in. Scroll down to learn more about the actress who's joining Kelly and Sarah Pidgeon in the show. Is Dree Hemingway related to Ernest Hemingway? Yes, Ernest Hemingway is Dree Hemingway's great-grandfather on her maternal side. Her mother is actress Mariel Hemingway, who is Ernest's granddaughter, and her aunt was Mariel's sister, actress and model Margaux Hemingway. Margaux died by suicide in 1996. Mariel began acting when she was just 14 years old, with roles in productions includingÂ Lipstick, Manhattan, Personal Best,Â and more. She was also on the ABC showÂ Civil Wars from 1991 to 1993. Mariel is still acting today, although her roles are few and far between, as she spends a lot of her time advocating for mental health and wellness. What has Dree Hemingway starred in? Dree began her career as a model in 2009. She has walked in runway shows and modeled in campaigns for brands including Gucci, Valentino, Chanel, and more. She also appeared inÂ Playboy in 2016. For the most part, Dree's acting career has been in independent films. She made her first leading appearance in the 2012 filmÂ Starlet. Her other credits include 2014'sÂ Listen Up Philip andÂ While We're Young, as well as the filmsÂ The People Garden, Live Cargo, It Happened in L.A.,Â andÂ Love After Love, among others. Is Dree Hemingway in a relationship? Yes, Dree is in a relationship with Nick Delli Santi. In December 2024, he honored her on her birthday with an Instagram tribute, writing, â€œYou're wild, you're weird and you're so loved. Don't ever change. Happy Birthdayâ¤ï¸ I love you.â€ Dree Hemingway/Instagram Does Dree Hemingway have kids? Yes, Dree has a daughter who was born in March 2023. â€œI can't believe my baby is two!!!!!!â€ she wrote on Instagram on her baby's second birthday. â€œI'm crying. I'm so beyond proud to be this little angels mother. I have never felt more love. Thank you Luce for choosing me â™¡ I'm so lucky and honored. The biggest gift is you.â€ On Mother's Day 2025, she also gushed, â€œI'm a mom and it's the best.â€ American Love Story,Â February 2026, FX

â€‰ ABSTRACT Denied a seat at Jonathan Anderson's Dior debut, a fashion critic invited all of Paris to watch it with him at a bar. Hundreds took him up on the offer. FULL TEXT July 9,2025, Wednesday         Online Correction: This article has been revised to reflect the following correction: An earlier version of this article described incorrectly Elias Medini's explanation of his dismissal from Interview magazine. Mr. Medini said that he had become "a liability" after a negative Dior review, not that the magazine did not want to damage its relationship with LVMH. CORRECTION APPENDED Denied a seat at Jonathan Anderson's Dior debut, a fashion critic invited all of Paris to watch it with him at a bar. Hundreds took him up on the offer. When attendees gathered last month at Les Invalides in Paris for Jonathan Anderson's debut show for Dior, the mood was solemn. The celebrities, editors and executives, gathered together in a complex of 17th-century buildings that honor France's military history, sat in quiet anticipation. Across town, a far more vocal crowd of students, writers and tourists packed into a bar and sipped beer, cracked jokes and erupted into cheers or groans as each of Mr. Anderson's looks was revealed. The second crowd was at a watch party thrown by Elias Medini, 26, a fashion commentator and critic known by many as Lyas. The hastily assembled get-together was Mr. Medini's response to not receiving an invite to the Dior show. "I was sad and I was like: So what am I going to do? Watch it at home on my TV or in the metro on my phone?" he said in an interview. Mr. Medini took action. He posted a message on social media in which he invited all of Paris to watch the show with him at Le Saint Denis, a cafe and bar in the city's 10th Arrondissement. He brought his TV from home and arranged the seats to accommodate a modest audience. To his surprise, nearly 300 people showed up. And unlike a traditional fashion show, there was no list at the door, no assigned seating and no opinions drawn out in hushed tones. "Real people react to art, but fashion people don't," Mr. Medini said. "Is the snobbism so high that you can't even smile?" "I really tried to break all of that down and to make it accessible to new people," he added. Mr. Medini is used to being a fashion outsider. He grew up in Rouen, a small town in Normandy, France, where he often had no one to discuss fashion with. During the pandemic, he began posting quick, unfiltered reaction videos to magazine covers and runway shows. As his follower count grew, brands took notice and many invited him to their shows and presentations. He quickly learned, however, that while the fashion industry thrives on newness, shaking up the structure and being candid about how he felt about a collection was frowned upon. Especially if he wanted to keep getting brand deals and make a living doing this work. "It's an industry where no one really wanted to speak their mind," Mr. Medini said. "Me as well. I entered the business and I started shutting my mouth. At one point, I realized that I was losing my integrity and I was losing the very reason that brought me here in the first place." Mr. Medini said he reached a breaking point after he attended a Dior show by Maria Grazia Chiuri, the company's former creative director, last September. He described it as "one of the worst shows I had seen at the time" and decided to post a critical review as a way to "tell people that I could not be bought." Because of the negative review, Mr. Medini feared that LVMH, the parent company of Dior, would blacklist him from shows. While he did not receive an invite to Mr. Anderson's show, he said it was for a less dramatic reason: The brand had opted not to invite influencers - a label Mr. Medini bristles at. There were, however, other consequences to the review. He said he was dismissed from his role atInterviewmagazine, where he had been a fashion correspondent, after he "became a liability." Representatives for Interview did not respond to requests for comment. Determined to make the best of things, Mr. Medini felt a watch party was a way to reclaim space and open the Dior show up to other fashion fans. To many of the people who attended, it was a perfect solution. "It's like the Champions League final for the girls and the gays," said Nelly Inayetyan, 22, a graphic design student in Paris. "The atmosphere was so special. For a couple of hours, a regular cafe turned into a buzzing fashion hub." Ms. Inayetyan, who doesn't consider herself to be a staunch follower of the fashion industry, found the experience inviting. Being able to see a show in the presence of others like her made it memorable....

â€‰ Chelsea Odufu is a multidisciplinary artist whose visual language bridges Afrofuturism, cinematic storytelling, and global fine art. From her intercontinental upbringing to her current work with Darren Aronofsky's creative studio, Chromista, Odufu possesses a unique cultural fluency that drives her influence as a genre-crossing artist. Championed by a rare creative partner, Odufu is realizing a bold vision in the fashion industry and beyond. International Origins Though her roots remain in CÃ´te d'Ivoire, Odufu's origins were truly international. It is this lens that has given her a unique eye for global commercial art, fine art, film, and fashion. Through her international lived experience, however, Odufu recognized a key oversight of the commercial art industry: Africa's unmatched visual style is too often overlooked on the world stage. â€œI think Africa gets overlooked in most of these fashion and travel campaigns,â€ Odufu explained. â€œI want to bring us into the conversation. So, as for my personal storyâ€”where I began and how it influences me nowâ€”it all goes back to Africa. The warmth, its love of people, the colors and clothing, an unmatchable swag.â€ Building a Multidisciplinary Style Odufu has developed herself into a multidisciplinary artist, seeing herself as genre-fluid. She operates artistically across film, installation, sculpture, design, fashion, music, social impact, travel, anthropology, millinery, and commercial direction, among other fields. Simply put, she isn't one to let a medium define her. â€œI'm known by Google as a 'film director,'â€ Odufu shared, â€œbut [I've] made an Afrofuturist steel sculpture that was light-based, with no video elements, purely form and concept. You have to make work for the time and place.â€ The Challenge of Thought Leadership This willingness to embrace and move between genres has led Odufu to be considered a thought leader in her own right, but it has also created its own challenges. As an artist, she found that there is a certain expectation for creatives to fit into single categoriesâ€”director, sculptor, designer, or otherwise. Still, as Odufu says, â€œI don't create for boxes.â€ Industry Success and Chromista Collaboration Although faced with industry skepticism, Odufu has achieved considerable success through her work. As a director, she has partnered with notable brands such as Chanel, Bose, Doc Martens, and Chase. In the fashion industry, she has successfully launched her hat brand, Astheria. In fine arts, she boasts installations at the Los Angeles Contemporary Art Museum, Paris Photo, Christie's London, and Dakar Biennale, as well as an upcoming show at The Shed. Ultimately, one of Odufu's proudest achievements is becoming a creative talent at Aronofsky's Chromista, a creative content company supporting her unique approach to the arts. Working with Chromista has given her the support to refine her cinematic voice as she continues moving across media. With the company, she has been able to push her commercial and conceptual work in bold new directions. Ambition for the Future Moving forward, Odufu hopes to expand the scope and scale of her projects, collaborating with more influencers, voices, and brands than before to uplift artists from around the world. She particularly hopes to make major avant-garde art projects which showcase her inspiration surrounding her culture and her home continent. With support from Aronofsky and Chromista, she is sure to achieve her goals. Presented by: APG

â€‰ It's a daunting task proposing to a jewellery designer, but one that Alex Chandler proved himself more than up to when he popped the question to Kitty Fuller, founder of jewellery brand Kitty Joyas, in 2024. Knowing how important the design would be to his future wife, Alex got in touch with her under a pseudonym (Matthew Percy Jones) to commission a bespoke engagement ring for his girlfriend â€“ with the sole instruction that whatever Kitty would love, he knew his girlfriend would love too. On the day the ring was scheduled to be collected, Kitty was confused to meet not a stranger, but her boyfriend of six years. â€œI was like, 'What are you doing here?'â€ Fuller remembers. â€œHe said, 'I'm Matthew', took the ring and got down on one knee.â€ Kitty approached planning the wedding with all the same artistry and craftsmanship she applies to her jewellery design (every piece is made in her London studio by her and her artisans) â€“ starting with the stationery. The invitations and menus were handwritten and painted by Kitty herself, before being digitised by her mother (who not only hosted the wedding but whom Kitty credits with being a â€œbig part of the creative visionâ€), a graphic designer by trade. The email listed for RSVPs? None other than Matthew Percy Jones, an adorable Easter egg for those who knew the engagement story. The bride and groom met in Barcelona where Kitty was training as a jewellery designer (hence her brand's name: Joyas means jewellery in Spanish), but they were friends for some time before things became romantic. â€œIt was a bit of a slow burner,â€ Kitty recalls, â€œbut it's amazing to have basically grown up togetherâ€. Kitty says Alex's ability to make her laugh (â€œhe was so much fun, he still isâ€) was one of the reasons romance blossomed, and a smile spreads across her face as she remembers their early years together: â€œWe were in our carefree twenties, working but not really having to pay much rent and just hopping from beach to beach.â€ Kitty had imagined her wedding dress before she was even engaged, inspired by a gown she had seen in the Chanel exhibition at London's V&A museum. â€œI took a picture and sent it to my mum and said 'If I ever get married, this is what I wantâ€¦ In some way.'â€ As fate would have it, Kitty stumbled across a similar archival style by Alice Temperley at pre-loved bridal store Gillian Million in Teddington. It should come as no surprise that when it came to her wedding look, the jewellery was pivotal to Kitty. â€œNormally brides want to be quite pared-back with their jewellery because it's all about the dress,â€ Kitty laughs, â€œbut, obviously, for me, jewellery should be more important.â€ In Kitty's case, it all began with a brooch. Featuring a citrine central stone surrounded by pearls, it belonged to Alex's late mother. â€œI always wanted to repurpose something for the day, and I didn't know what until I saw this,â€ Kitty continues. â€œI just fell in love with it.â€ After Alex's father had given his blessing, Kitty set to work turning it into a striking pendant necklace on a string of delicate pearls. On the day, she paired it with matching pearl and citrine earrings and â€œsomething borrowedâ€: her grandmother's engagement ring. In another nod to the couple's Spanish love story, Kitty didn't have bridesmaids, she had Â seven, including her sister, â€œthe best chicaâ€. Each wore handmade Kitty Joyas Mi CorazÃ³n drop earrings featuring romantic, oversized hearts and organic freshwater pearls. The chicas weren't the only ones to receive custom jewellery for the day: the mother of the bride also had bespoke Kitty Joyas earrings, and Kitty's father and brother had bangles.
â€‰ Not even funny how tight security is at these events yet you can just freely row across the Chanel and invade Britain

â€‰ Jelly shoes are the latest of the 00s trends to make a comeback, and Georgia Toffolo has found the perfect red pair from Marks and Spencer for her Maldives holiday This article contains affiliate links, we will receive a commission on any sales we generate from it. Learn more Although the resurgence of the 00s trends has been slowly creeping back in for a while now, it seems it has truly hit its peak recently with the return of the jelly shoes. As soon as luxury brands started sending their own versions down the runway, it became official â€“ they're the shoe of the summer. And in case you needed any more convincing, former Made in Chelsea star Georgia Toffolo has also been spotted wearing a pair during her trip to the Maldives, where she shared a photo declaring: â€œJelly shoes are well and truly back and I'm here for it.â€ She also shared where to shop her exact pair, with her Jelly Slip On Ballet Pumps being a surprisingly affordable Â£19.50 pick from Marks & Spencer. READ MORE: Olivia Attwood's Â£46 boucle mini dress gets mistaken for Chanel by fans READ MORE: Louise Thompson's 'incredibly comfortable' Ugg mules are perfect for flying in The jelly shoes are the perfect pick for summer, with the mesh design making them breathable and comfortable to wear, as well as meaning you can wear them on the beach without them filling up with sand. The plastic material also means they should be perfectly fine to wear in the water, so you can paddle in the sea or pop them on around the pool without worrying about them getting ruined. Toff's Jelly Slip On Ballet Pumps also have the classic ballet flat style that makes them easy to wear with a whole host of different outfits. The flat heel also keeps them comfortable enough to be worn all day long. Pair them with jeans and a T-shirt for days in the city, or throw them on with your bikini and a sarong (just like Toff) for an afternoon at the beach. You could also pair them with a flowy maxi skirt or a linen co-ord for more casual evenings out. The M&S Jelly Slip On Ballet Pumps are already selling quickly, with only sizes five, six and seven currently in stock in the red colour. You can however still nab the silvery grey colourway in all sizes from a three to an eight. If you do want a red pair but have missed out on your size with the M&S pair, you could pick up the Juju Jellies Kris In Red from Schuh instead, which are currently on sale down from Â£26 to Â£17.99. Alternatively, nab yourself the Â£29.99 Jelly Mesh Ballet Flats from Amazon which have been compared favourably to The Row's designer version by reviewers. However the Marks & Spencer Jelly Slip On Ballet Pumps have also been getting plenty of positive reviews of their own, with one saying: â€œPerfect for summer, nice colour, son comfortable and fit well.â€ Another agreed: â€œThese jelly shoes are really comfortable. I bought the transparent ones and my granddaughter thinks they are glass slippers! I have popped them on to do the school run . . visit a Nursery. . and have dashed into town. I'm so glad I came across them on the website and am happy to recommend them.â€ Some had some minor issues, adding: â€œPerfect for the beach. Very comfortable. Wouldn't want to wear them for a lot of walking around as they would make your feet sweat. Feel very light but not much support.â€ Others however couldn't wait to wear them on holiday, writing: â€œJust what I wanted for the beach and pool side. Very comfortable and light. â€‰ Okay, here's a breakdown of the information presented in the text, organized for clarity. It appears to be a customer service guide regarding refunds,specifically related to taxes and customs duties when returning goods to Korea. I. General Refund Information (First Section) Voluntary Reporting is Key: If you don't voluntarily report the goods for tax purposes upon entering Korea, you cannot get a refund. Taxation customs Clearance Refund: This section details the documents needed for a refund related to taxes paid during customs clearance. Portable taxation customs clearance statement (requires voluntary reporting) Payment receipt (for the taxes paid) Return and refunding water confirmation (issued by duty-free shops) Personal information usage agreement Refund application (implied) II. Volunteer Disposal Products/Refund/Tax Refund Information Refund Process: Report the goods voluntarily when entering Korea. Taxation is possible with a taxation customs clearance statement (customs salary) and a payment receipt. Necessary documents for Refund: Refund application Customs clearance statement Return and refund confirmation (from duty-free shops) Copy of deposit accounts (for receiving the refund) UNIPASS System: Refunds can be applied for through the UNIPASS system (korea Customs Service's electronic system) if all requirements and documents are met. III. Refunds for Goods Below the Tax Exemption Threshold No reporting needed: Exchanges and refunds for goods below the tax exemption threshold don't require reporting or customs procedures. Duty-Free Goods exchange: Exchanging duty-free goods requires cancellation and must follow the duty-free shop's purchase and delivery process from the departure hall. Company Pays: (The text is cut off here,but implies the company covers some cost). In essence, the document outlines a process for getting refunds on taxes paid on imported goods that are being returned to Korea, emphasizing the importance of voluntary reporting and providing a list of required documentation. Key Takeaways: Voluntary reporting: This is the most important aspect. Documentation: Gather all the listed documents before applying for a refund. UNIPASS: The primary system for processing refunds. * Duty-Free Specifics: Duty-free purchases have a different exchange process. Table of Contents Welcome to the definitive guide to Shilla Duty Free,your gateway to a world of luxury shopping and exclusive offers. Whether you're a seasoned traveler or a first-time visitor, Shilla Duty Free offers an unparalleled shopping experience with a curated selection of high-end brands, remarkable services, and a refined atmosphere. This guide will navigate you through the various facets of Shilla Duty Free, ensuring you make the most of your visit. Please note,that while the â€œShilla Ratherennet Duty Free Shopâ€ was specified in the query,only facts about â€œShilla Duty Free Shopâ€ was available in the search results. This guide will focus on shilla Duty Free Shop,as the other shop might not exist,or might be a typo in the query. What is Shilla Duty Free? Shilla Duty Free, affiliated with the prestigious Shilla Hotel under the Samsung Group of South Korea [[2]], has established itself as a premier destination for discerning shoppers sence its opening in 1986 [[2]]. Renowned for its fashionable products, competitive prices, elegant shopping environment, and warm, high-quality services [[2]], Shilla Duty Free attracts both domestic and international tourists. Located next to the Hotel Shilla [[1]], it offers differentiated hotel-style services, including a guest lounge and cafeteria, as well as high-class facilities [[1]]. Why Shop at Shilla Duty Free? Shilla Duty Free stands out from other duty-free retailers for several compelling reasons: Extensive Brand Selection: Discover a vast array of luxury brands across various categories,including cosmetics,fashion,watches,jewelry,and more. Competitive prices: Enjoy tax-free shopping and exclusive discounts, making luxury goods more accessible. Elegant Shopping Environment: Immerse yourself in a sophisticated and cozy atmosphere, designed to enhance your shopping experience. Exceptional Services: Benefit from personalized customer service, including assistance from multilingual staff, personal shoppers, and concierge services. Hotel-Style Amenities: Take advantage of convenient amenities such as guest lounges and cafeterias to relax and recharge during your shopping spree [[1]]. â€‰ I picked upÂ [Haramain Floral Fair](https://alharamainperfume.online/products/haramain-floral-fair-100ml-extrait-de-parfum?variant=44270172176441)Â on a whim, thinking it might just be another pretty floral. But I was wrongâ€”it's not just pretty. It'sÂ *elegant*,Â *sophisticated*, and honestly one of the most well-crafted floral perfumes I've smelled at this price point. This isn't a flowerbomb in your face. This isÂ **a garden in full bloom**, wrapped in morning light, misted with fresh air, and warmed ever so gently by soft earth and skin. Let me walk you through this one ! [img](tbp6xrdhtgbf1) # ğŸŒ¹ Opening: Soft Petals & Morning Sparkle Right away, you're greeted withÂ **rose**,Â **bergamot**, and a dash ofÂ **ginger**. It's like standing in a garden just as the sun peeks over the horizonâ€”the rose is tender and dewy, not overly powdery or mature. The bergamot adds a light citrus sparkle, and the ginger brings a surprising butÂ *very welcome*Â bit of warmth and spice. It's luminous, like fresh petals kissed with early morning light. Feminine without being overly sweet. You immediately know you're in the presence of something refined. # ğŸ’ Heart: Creamy, Airy, and Dreamy The heart is whereÂ **Floral Fair**Â truly sings. * **Tuberose**Â gives it that creamy white floral depth. * **Jasmine**Â adds a bit of brightness and sparkle. * **White flowers**Â tie everything together with a fresh, airy elegance. This phase is floaty, but never flimsy. Think bridal bouquet meets blooming meadowâ€”with elegance dialed up to 10. It's modern and clean, but still romantic. People who normally shy away from heady florals might still enjoy thisâ€”it's never cloying or old-fashioned. ! [img](wlam0n5itgbf1) # ğŸŒ³ Base: Soft Woods & Subtle Sensuality And then, it lingers on a base ofÂ **musk**,Â **patchouli**, and a softÂ **oak**Â woodiness. This part is subtle but beautiful. The patchouli isÂ *not dirty or earthy*â€”it's smooth and just anchors the florals nicely. TheÂ **musk**Â gives it a soft skin-like dry-down, and theÂ **oak**Â adds a classy, grounded touch that stops this from ever floating off into fairy land. It becomes something you could confidently wear to work or a nice dinner out. # ğŸ§´ Packaging & Presentation 100ml of extrait de parfum (yes, extrait!) in a classy, feminine bottle that matches the elegance inside. It feels weighty, looks great on a vanity, and gives off â€œgraceful woman in control of her lifeâ€ vibes. # ğŸ•°ï¸ Performance & Projection * **Longevity**: 8-9 hours on skin. Lasts longer on fabric. * **Projection**: Soft to moderate. People will smell it if they're near youâ€”but it doesn't scream. * **Sillage**: A gentle floral trail that leans intimate and inviting. More romantic than bombastic. This is very much aÂ *you'll get compliments if someone hugs you*Â type of fragrance. # ğŸŒ¼ Who Should Try Floral Fair? This is for the floral lovers who: * Want somethingÂ **classic but modern** * Love scents likeÂ **Chanel Gabrielle**,Â **Amouage Honour Woman**, orÂ **Dior J'Adore**Â but are seeking something more niche-feeling (and affordable!) * Need a go-to fragrance for weddings, spring/summer outings, or daily wear that still feelsÂ *special* If you like clean white florals with a creamy, musky finishâ€”**this is it**....

â€‰ While fakes have been around a long time, it's not really comparable. Fakes of almost everything from guitars to guitar strings have just exploded since 2020. I've had several sets off of Amazon which I have returned due to being fake. I think twice about buying guitars used these days, too. The worst thing about it is the very guy who decides to order a fake guitar. First it perpetuates the industry of knock-offs. These are the same guys who demand that they are perfectly great guitars, a good tech will set it up to play awesome. Then in that case, why does it need to have a Gibson, ESP or Jackson logo at the top? The reality is most of these guitars are pure junk. Again despite the demands that they're "better than a real Gibson", I would question the ability of the person claiming that entirely. And even suggest that they are full of shit. The fakes I have had on my bench are anything but playable let alone comparable. Set necks so offset that they're never going to play right, neck twists so far out of whack it would be a write off on a Â£20k guitar, bodies that visibly contort in the heat, truss rods that do nothing due to completely improper installation... The second major point is that I'm sure that (the proverbial) you would never attempt to masquerade a fake guitar as real! I am sure an upstanding lad such as yourself would never even consider trying to trade off something you know well to be fake as the real deal. But the guy five owners along from you, are you sure? And ultimately, yes, you share in the responsibility for that guy five ahead of you ripping someone off. As a tech of near on 25 years, I have had the face to face when someone has brought me a guitar to repair that I have had to lay the bad news that it's fake. Most of the guys who get caught are the sort of players who given family life, or what have you, finally get the go ahead from the wife/husband to finally buy a decent guitar after years of raising families, etc. They're middle aged, been saving up a while and suddenly come across something that fits the bill real nice and the guy only wants Â£2000, not Â£5000. A lot of these guys are not read up on guitars in general, they just like to play and they want that real American strat, or real Jimmy Page LP, or whatever. Deal done, they think they've had a bargain, it doesn't ever cross their minds that someone actually fakes guitars. These are not gucci wallets or bottles of Chanel no. 5. When I get to tell them that it's firewood, barely worth Â£100 in scrap, usually due to the very construction of the thing being so flawed, it's not fixable, the realisation that they have been conned is huge. I've seen at least one grown man cry over it. They had one chance to get one nice guitar in life, it took an age to save up let alone get the other half's blessing, and it turns out they've wasted their money and been conned. And if you're ordering this scrap yourself, you are part of that. And sure, you can be all righteous and say, "Sorry he shoulda done his research!" If that is what makes you sleep better at night, then your bed is comfier than mine. If you are about the business of ordering fakes of temu or ali or whatever else, don't bullshit me like you have bullshitted your own self. You're a con man and nothing more. And any tech worth their salt would pass on assisting you in making that thing play, or even refitting "genuine" hardware to help you pass it off. Any time I've been given a fake to work up, it's gone back to the owner, no work done. If you're a tech, don't support this trade. There is no good genuine reason to buy a fake yourself. If you can't afford the real deal, then tough. Not everybody gets to be an astronaut.

â€‰ Imagine discovering your favorite luxury perfume at 70% off retail price, delivered to your doorstep with guaranteed authenticity. This isn't fantasyâ€”it's the reality FragranceNet Discount Fragrances created when it pioneered online discount fragrance retail in 1997. Founded by entrepreneur Steve Lightman in New York, FragranceNet transformed from a modest startup into a global powerhouse, democratizing access to luxury scents through innovative e-commerce strategies. Today, it serves millions of customers across 200+ countries, leveraging cutting-edge technology and direct manufacturer relationships to uphold its reputation for authenticity and value. As the digital fragrance market surgesâ€”projected to reach $84.8 billion globally by 2030â€”FragranceNet's revolutionary model continues to shape how consumers experience luxury. FragranceNet Discount Fragrances: Market Leadership Redefined FragranceNet Discount Fragrances dominates the online perfume landscape through a potent blend of strategic sourcing, technological agility, and customer-centric innovation. By partnering directly with over 1,200 brands (including Chanel, Dior, and Tom Ford), FragranceNet bypasses traditional retail markups, offering authentic perfumes at 20â€“80% discounts. Its market position is validated by staggering metrics: 17+ million annual site visitors, $500M+ estimated revenue, and a 97% customer satisfaction rate according to 2023 Trustpilot data. The brand's proprietary authentication systemâ€”using batch codes and manufacturer verificationâ€”combats counterfeit risks that plague 40% of online luxury sales per the Global Anti-Counterfeiting Group. Crucially, FragranceNet built trust through transparency. Every product page details scent notes, concentration levels, and batch-specific expiration dates. Their â€œ365-Day Return Policyâ€ and FDA-compliant storage facilities (audited annually) further reinforce reliability. When supply chain disruptions hit during the pandemic, FragranceNet's diversified warehouse network across the US and Europe ensured continuityâ€”a key reason it gained 32% new customers between 2020â€“2022 while competitors faltered. Key innovations driving their dominance: AI-Powered Personalization: Algorithms analyze purchase history and reviews to recommend scents, boosting conversion rates by 35%  ScentMatch Technology: Virtual tool matching fragrance preferences to new discoveries  Climate-Controlled Logistics: Preserves perfume integrity during global shipping  Subscription Models: Regular scent deliveries with adjustable frequency The Origins and Evolution of FragranceNet FragranceNet's journey began in a Long Island warehouse, where Lightman identified a gap: luxury fragrances were overpriced due to layered distribution channels. By sourcing surplus inventory directly from manufacturers and authorized distributors, he created a discount model that maintained qualityâ€”a novelty in pre-ecommerce 1997. Early milestones included: 1997â€“2005: Foundation & Early Growth Launched as one of the first online perfume retailers  Secured partnerships with Elizabeth Arden and Calvin Klein  Implemented SSL encryption for transactions (rare for era) 2006â€“2015: Technological Leap Mobile-optimized site (2010), preceding 75% of competitors  Warehouse automation doubled order processing speed  Expanded into skincare and makeup, increasing SKUs to 15,000+ 2016â€“Present: Global Scaling Acquired European retailer Parfumdreams (2021), adding 2.2 million customers  Launched eco-friendly packaging initiative, reducing plastic use by 48%  Partnered with influencers like Jeremy Fragrance for authentic reviews This strategic evolution mirrors shifts in consumer behavior documented in Harvard Business School's e-commerce case studies , which highlight how discount models thrive when paired with authenticity guarantees. Industry-Shaping Products and Services FragranceNet's 20,000+ product catalog spans niche artisans to designer icons, but several offerings revolutionized retail: Tester Program: Unboxed bottles used in stores sold at 50â€“70% discounts. This sustainable model diverted 12 million units from landfills since 2018. Gift Sets & Travel Sizes: Curated collections and miniatures (like Viktor&Rolf's Flowerbomb trio) introduced luxury to budget-conscious millennials. Travel sizes alone grew 200% post-pandemic. ScentClub Membership: For $49/year, members get 20% discounts, free shipping, and quarterly samplesâ€”a program retaining 85% of subscribers annually. These offerings reshaped expectations: 68% of buyers now prioritize value without sacrificing authenticity, per 2024 Statista surveys. Technology and Innovation Leadership FragranceNet's R&D investments focus on enhancing accessibility and trust: Blockchain Verification: Pilot program tracing fragrance origins from lab to doorstep  AR Try-On: Virtual scent simulator launching Q4 2024  Dynamic Pricing AI: Adjusts discounts in real-time based on demand/supply Their patent-pending authentication API is licensed to retailers like Sephora, demonstrating industry influence. â€‰ SPR_COMBO[it]Divisa tra le ambizioni e la passione, tra l'immagine pubblica luminosa e le ombre del privato, la veritÃ  di una donna straordinaria in cerca soprattutto di se stessa. 1958. Raggiante e inarrivabile come un'imperatrice, Romy Schneider scende dalla scaletta dell'aereo che Ã¨ appena atterrato a Parigi, accolta da una folla di fotografi. A neanche vent'anni Ã¨ giÃ  una star di fama mondiale e per tutti incarna la grazia e l'innocenza della principessa Sissi, il personaggio che l'ha resa celebre, ma che sta diventando una gabbia che le impedisce di crescere come attrice. Giunta in Francia per conoscere il coprotagonista del suo nuovo film, si indigna scoprendo che si tratta di un giovane e arrogante sconosciuto: Alain Delon. Non immagina certo che l'istintiva antipatia che prova per quel ragazzo ribelle e un po' spaccone, dai capelli nerissimi e lo sguardo di un blu profondo, di lÃ¬ a poco si trasformerÃ  in un amore folle e tormentato. Svincolatasi dalla tirannia della madre e del patrigno, che vogliono convincerla a impersonare Sissi per la quarta volta, Romy decide di trasferirsi nella capitale francese, dove assapora finalmente la libertÃ  e la passione. Ma la sua carriera rimane in stallo finchÃ©, durante una vacanza con Alain in Italia, Romy incontra il grande regista Luchino Visconti che le propone una sfida eccitante: un ruolo a teatro. SarÃ  proprio lui a suggerire a Romy un cambio di look e a farle conoscere la carismatica Coco Chanel, che trasformerÃ  l'attrice in una vera icona di stile e, nonostante i modi dispotici e irriverenti, diverrÃ  per lei un'intima amica e confidente. Intanto, perÃ², i rapporti con Alain si fanno sempre piÃ¹ burrascosiâ€¦ Annunci Titolo: Romy Schneider, un amore a Parigi Autore: Michelle Marly Editore: Giunti Genere: Narrativa, biografia Data pubblicazione: 20 Ottobre 2021 Voto: 4-/5 â­â­â­â­ Classificazione: 4 su 5. Acquista su Amazon -> #pubblicitÃ  Annunci Recensione Bentornati, lettori! Oggi vi presento un altro affascinante volume della serie â€œMuse, storie di grandi donneâ€ edita da Giunti. Si tratta di â€œRomy Schneider, un amore a Parigiâ€ di Michelle Marly, un libro che esplora la vita dell'indimenticabile attrice Romy Schneider. Nel 1958, Romy, giÃ  una star ventenne, arriva a Parigi, ma si sente intrappolata nel ruolo di Sissi. Qui incontra Alain Delon, un attore emergente per cui inizialmente prova antipatia, ma che diventerÃ  il suo grande e tormentato amore. Romy si ribella ai genitori e si trasferisce a Parigi per cercare la sua libertÃ . Annunci La svolta nella sua carriera avviene in Italia, dove incontra il regista Luchino Visconti, che le offre un'opportunitÃ  teatrale stimolante. Visconti la introduce anche a Coco Chanel, che la trasforma in un'icona di stile e diventa una sua fidata amica. Nel frattempo, la sua relazione con Alain diventa sempre piÃ¹ turbolenta. La narrazione esplora il percorso di Romy alla ricerca di se stessa, tra ambizioni professionali e vicende personali complesse. Essendo una grande appassionata dei film della Principessa Sissi, non potevo non leggere questo libro dedicato alla straordinaria Romy Schneider. Appena ho scoperto che Giunti le aveva dedicato un volume, l'ho acquistato all'istante. Devo ammettere, perÃ², che pur non essendo il peggiore della serie â€œMuse, storie di grandi donneâ€œ, non Ã¨ nemmeno il migliore. Annunci In alcuni momenti ho faticato a seguire la narrazione, forse perchÃ© appesantita da una cronologia troppo rigida dei fatti, quasi fosse una telecronaca. Inoltre, il libro si concentra eccessivamente su un periodo limitato della vita dell'attrice, dando troppo spazio alla sua relazione con Alain Delon, e termina in modo brusco. Mi sarei aspettata molto di piÃ¹ da un testo di questo calibro, come se l'autrice avesse timore di sbilanciarsi. Alla fine, si comprende il motivo di questa reticenza: l'autrice ha conosciuto e frequentato la famiglia Schneider, e probabilmente non voleva fare loro un torto. Nonostante le mie riserve, questo libro ti farÃ  sognare e ti permetterÃ  di scoprire molto di piÃ¹ su Romy Schneider, un'attrice che ancora oggi viene immediatamente associata al volto della Principessa Sissi. Alla fine, il testo mi Ã¨ piaciuto, anche se sento che gli sia mancato un pizzico di coraggio nell'esprimere appieno la complessitÃ  della sua vita. Annunci Lo consiglio vivamente a tutte le appassionate dei film di Romy, perchÃ© offre l'opportunitÃ  di conoscere a fondo la donna dietro la giovane adolescente che ha interpretato l'imperatrice. Ma c'Ã¨ molto di piÃ¹ da scoprire, e solo leggendolo potrai svelare tutti i segreti della sua affascinante esistenza! Voto 4-/5. â€‰ >And which legends are channeled prior to death, proving this? Joko. His legend is from his undead state, so he never died after becoming a legend. Jalis may very well be alive still too, technically. >We know 2 things: revenants use the power of the mists to chanel the power of legendary heros, and death in the guild wars universe involves some aspect of oneself to transfer into these mists, in which you experience the afterlife described by ones beliefs, mostly sorted by race. You do realize that living beings can go to the Mists and even enter the afterlife, right? It's, in fact, done in both games on multiple occasions each. One doesn't need to die to enter the Mists. PvP and WvW are all about going to the Mists. Nayos is in the Mists. We visit Kormir in the Mists. >nor have we received an explanation of how exactly Joko's litch resurrection works. We have though? It isn't resurrection. Liches souls are bound to their bodies, preventing separation. So they never die. They can be defeated, and will often feign death. To quote a GW1 character about The Hunter, a Shiro'ken given lichdom by Vizier Khilbron: *"What is it? * [*The Hunter*](https://wiki.guildwars.com/wiki/The_Hunter) *and the Pack.... Yes I know of them. You've gained the attention of some very powerful beings there. If you are careful, or stronger than you look, you can kill members of the Pack. The Hunter...well the Hunter is a much more powerful being. You see,* ***he's never truly dead****. If you beat him down, he will wait until danger has passed and then regenerate and begin the hunt anew. * ***He cannot be killed. *** *Now, if that is all you require of me, I ask to be free of your presence." * Vizier Khilbron himself needed his soul torn out of his body by the power of the Bloodstone in the Ring of Fire. â€‰ Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com The Real Housewives of Orange County's Emily Simpson was overcome with emotion when she recently revealed that her young son Luke has been diagnosed with a rare eating disorder. The reality TV personality, 49, opened up about her son's diagnosis of Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID) during an interview withÂ People. She broke the news shortly after another RHOC star, Tamra Judge, was called out for falsely saying that she had been diagnosed with autism. Before Emily's son's diagnosis, she had always just assumed he was just a picky eater, she told the outlet. 'He only eats a few different foods and he's very overwhelmed by texture, color, smells. He will only eat white rice,' Simpson, 49, said of what Luke's main symptoms are. 'And he has to inspect each piece of rice before he eats it. So it's beyond picky eating. A lot of control issues. It's very overwhelming.' Emily shared that prior to learning about her son's condition, he would often say he was 'starving' â€” because he was â€” but would still 'refuse to eat.' 'As a mom, that was so frustrating,' she confessed. 'I didn't know what to do because on one hand he's crying and telling me he's starving, and on the other hand, he refuses to eat anything that I offer.' The condition causes a person to lose interest in eating over anxietyâ€“filled fears of choking, vomiting or a need to avoid unwanted colors, taste, textures or smells of different foods, per the Cleveland Clinic. The Bravo star saidÂ that every day is still 'challenging' but she tries to put herself in Luke's 'shoes.' 'Smells are extremely overwhelming for him. Color is overwhelming for him. Textures of food are overwhelming and make him gag,' the reality star said. 'So I have to constantly remind myself that he doesn't operate neurologically like we do.' The Cleveland Clinic states that treatment options include cognitive behavioral therapy and medications like antipsychotic medications, antidepressants or others that stimulate a person's appetite. Emily also took to Instagram to share her thanks to those who reached out to her after the People article was published. 'Hello Friends! â¤ï¸â¤ï¸, she began. ' First, thank you so much for your support, kindness and love regarding Luke. 'This was by far my most difficult season filming RHOC I've ever had, and there were multiple times I felt that it was in Luke's best interest for me to quit. 'My reason for continuing on and navigating this truly challenging time (in real time and on camera) was because I knew I'd get more answers, support and feedback than any therapist or doctor could provide. 'The Bravo fans are incredible and caring people, and I wasn't wrong,' she continued. 'Thank you for the information and support you are all sending my way! Please keep it coming and please talk to your children about being kind to the kids who might be a little different â¤ï¸â¤ï¸.' She concluded by throwing it back to RHOC, 'Secondly, what did you think of episode one?!' Fans will see her face Luke's diagnosis in real time, since it happened while she was filming season 19 of RHOC. 'There were lots of times I didn't even know if I could continue to film,' she said. ' [Husband] Shane and I are learning every day how to navigate it.' Emily said Luke is currently in therapy and working with a nutritionist. And his diet has expanded to include not only rice but also. french fries, sliced bananas, potato chips, ice cream and plain turkey that 'doesn't have any lines or blemishes in it.' The worried mom admitted that its not easy to tread the line between trying to get him to eat new foods and not making him feel bad that he doesn't want to. Emily and Shane are also parents toÂ son Keller, 10, daughter Annabelle, 12, and Shane's daughters from his first marriage â€” Chanel, 19, and Shelby, 24.

â€‰ Kynren and Bishop Auckland deliver 'epic' tales and times reports DARREN GREENWOOD YOU may have seen the tv commercials, where Kynren brands itself as â€œan epic tale of England.â€ For once, here is an event that totally lives up to its billing. Kynren is a live outdoor show just outside Bishop Auckland in County Durham. The event is back for its tenth anniversary season, which literally does feature a cast of a thousand, not to mention hundreds of animals. RECOMMENDED READING: The thing is, as I was told by its organisers, all bar one in fifty of those taking part are volunteers. And when you think that so many people are showing such great commitment to rehearse, prepare and put on such a brilliant show, at times I did feel a little emotional. There was an amazing amount of professionalism shown, added to magnificent sets, mass choreography, combats, fine horsemanship, not to mention sheep, donkeys and geese, who all behaved perfectly. Now, Kynren is part of the regenerative efforts taking place in and around Bishop Auckland to give the town and surrounds a better future. Kynren is part of the 11Arches charity and I was invited up by them, Visit Durham and the Auckland Project, the latter of which operates a range of attractions in the area, again relying largely on volunteers. As we were told at the start of the show, Kynren is about where you are from, so we get to see recreations of vital moments of British history, with a local twist to reflect the County Durham location. We see how a young boy called Arthur embarks on a quest to experience events over the past 2000 years as he learns so much has happened in England. We see Ancient Britons, Romans, Vikings, we learn about Venerable Bede of Northumberland, jousting knights and then we see the Norman conquest, followed by a journey through agricultural times to the Industrial Revolution, with its coal mines and the Durham Gala. Children, goats and costumes present a colourful night New for this year is a special celebration of the 200th anniversary of the nearby Stockton and Darlington Railway, the birthplace of the modern railway. Kynren's full-scale replica of Locomotion No.1 made a spectacular appearance, crossing the stage. Also new was a reimagined performance of Queen Victoria making an entrance on a six-horse carriage, resplendent with intricate detailing and opulence, not to mention an impressive 150 performers and 20-plus horses. Adding to even more to the spectacle the fireworks, which began before the 20th century seemed to be skirted over, culminating in a grand finale of dancers, animals and the most impressive fireworks display I have enjoyed in years. Departure worked well, with plenty of room for people to leave the 8,000 seat areaÂ with ease and there were free buses to take you back to town. You won't go hungry either. There's a food court, which offers a lot of choice, including a tasty chicken curry! Spectacular horsemanship on show Before Kynren started you were able to see a most colourful Viking Village, complete with forge, farmers, traders and warriors all enjoying themselves. I was there for a media launch of Kynren and before the main show started its bosses spoke of their plans for the future. Parrots and other exotic birds arrived to highlight a future showÂ featuring birds, called the Lost Feather. This will be part of the permanent attraction , a historic theme park due open next year. There won't be rides but rather five shows and 'immersive experiences' taking you back through the ages, from neolithic times, the Viking era, the Victoria and reflectingÂ the locality, the story of the Wear and the Lambton Worm. The future theme park , due open in 2026 Also promised is - and epic spectacle where medieval knights clash on horseback, and a fearless female warrior's courage and skill are put to the test in a breathtaking display of horsemanship and daring stunts. It all augurs well and certainly Kynren and its volunteers so professionally bring history so vividly to life across 90 minutes or so. And they face a busy summer, performing every Saturday from next week, July 19, until Saturday September 13. It means that such an amazing show costs from just Â£30 to Â£61 for adults (from Â£20 for children), as so much expense clearly goes on creating such a great and dazzling show, from the performances, the costumes, the stunts, the animals, the spectacle, the fireworks, and so on instead of wages for so many. No wonder Kynren is rated 5-star on Tripadvisor and it rightfully promotes itself as the 'must see event of the summer.' I could not agree more. Royal pagaentry Now, as well as Kynren, Bishop Auckland has other attractions to make a decent stay worthwhile. There's the historic Auckland Palace, with its impressive interior and so many artefacts. There's the rather unique Faith Museum looking at religion throughout history. The Spanish Gallery is the UK's first gallery dedicated to the art and culture of the Spanish Golden Age. It features artworks by El Greco, Murillo, ZurbarÃ¡n and VelÃ¡zquez. You certainly get the feeling you are in Spain, and it was a delight to return. Over the road is the Mining Art Gallery with more than 400 works by prominent mining artists such as Tom McGuinness and Norman Cornish exploring life in the coal mines. Again, something great to see again. In addition to these fine attractions, the Auckland Project operates the Park Head Hotel, an excellent 3-star hotel, serving great food. The project also has holiday cottages and townhouses to stay in and the one I stayed was characterful, with period features. It was spotlessly clean with the most comfortable bed. Nearby Raby Castle was also worth the return visit for its 14th Century splendour, the extensive range of artefacts, the gardens and the extensive estateÂ with herds of deer, including white ones, where once more amid its quiet, I felt so relaxed and much at peace. This, my third excellent visit to the area, included The Bowes Museum at nearby Barnard Castle. This has been a museum since its creation centuries ago....

Un nuovo fashion hack d'ispirazione boho chic, che contiene in sÃ© altre due grandi tendenze delle ultime stagioni: quella delle maxi cinture statement e quella delle cinture Â«inutiliÂ», sfoggiate non per necessitÃ , ma per personalizzare l'ensemble. Quando indossare la bandana in vita e come abbinarla? Le opzioni vanno dalla vacanza alla cittÃ , da una festa in barca a un giro da turista, passando per l'ufficio e qualsiasi altra occasione possa capitare durante la giornata: questo accessorio sta bene con tutto, da un lungo abito estivo come quello di Stradivarius a un copricostume come quello di H&M, da un look total white con pantaloni palazzo a una classica combo jeans e maglietta o camicia. Non c'Ã¨ nemmeno una regola ben precisa per valorizzarlo. Si puÃ² scegliere se optare per un colore a contrasto o rimanere in palette, se non addirittura tono su tono: in ogni caso sarÃ  un dettaglio estremamente cool e inaspettato. Whether it's investigating the financials of Elon Musk's pro-Trump PAC or producing our latest documentary, 'The A Word', which shines a light on the American women fighting for reproductive rights, we know how important it is to parse out the facts from the messaging. At such a critical moment in US history, we need reporters on the ground. Your donation allows us to keep sending journalists to speak to both sides of the story. And unlike many other quality news outlets, we choose not to lock Americans out of our reporting and analysis with paywalls. Morgan Riddle's effect on Wimbledon semifinalist Taylor Fritz's rise in the rankings has been significant. He says so himself. A prominent figure at the All England Club this year, the fashion influencer and Fritz's partner, has told her hundreds of thousands of social media followers that tennis has become "the chicest sport in the world." While she frequently attends tournaments to cheer for him and was seated at Centre Court on Friday for her boyfriend Fritz's match against Carlos Alcaraz, her profile has also been boosted by features in Vogue, Harper's Bazaar, and The New York Times' Style section, and featured in the Netflix tennis documentary, "Break Point." Morgan Riddle went from Minnesota to New York and multiple internships Riddle, 27, is a Minnesota native who attended Wagner College in New York City. â€œBy the end of my junior year, I had completed seven internships,â€ she said in a Wagner College video about the Class of 2019 member. Riddle explained that the internships included gigs at a magazine, a newspaper, a government office, a coffee company startup and a real estate company, with tasks including social media. Riddle and Fritz met about five years ago. Taylor Fritz credits Morgan Riddle's influence Fritz was the U.S. Open runner-up last September â€” his first appearance in a Grand Slam final â€” and reached a career-high ranking of No. 4 in November. He says it's important to have someone â€œpush you in the right direction all the time, supporting you." He spoke about Riddle's role after his 6-3, 6-4, 1-6, 7-6 (4) victory over Karen Khachanov in the quarterfinals. â€œThere's an obvious correlation between my results and ranking and the time we've been together,â€ he said. â€œI would have to say she's been a big help to me, just kind of keeping me focused, having someone who cares and just pushes you to just do better and do the right things, be healthier.â€ Morgan Riddle promotes fashion and explains 'tenniscore' Riddle has worked with the All England Club to create video segments called â€œWimbledon Threads.â€ Wearing brands such as Chanel and Jimmy Choo, she details trends like â€œtenniscore.â€ â€œ'Tenniscore' isn't just about pleated skirts and vintage polos. It's about aspirational minimalism with a competitive edge,â€ she said in a video titled â€œHow Wimbledon made tennis chic.â€ She added that Wimbledon has â€œhelped tennis become the chicest sport in the world.â€ Riddle isn't afraid to throw a few zingers. â€œOf course, we're here for the tennis, but what was once a strictly sporting event has also turned into a global fashion spectacle. I know some of you may not want to hear that, but just because the fact annoys you, doesn't make it any less true,â€ she said. That segment has 12,300 views as of Friday â€” a different Wimbledon video featuring a kid asking Aryna Sabalenka about pancakes has more than double that. Riddle's clips on TikTok, where she has nearly 600,000 followers, are more popular. She also has more than 450,000 followers on Instagram. Fritz often takes photos of her to post on social media. â€œI've definitely gotten a lot better over the last couple of years but very reluctantly,â€ he said in an interview last year. â€œIt's very embarrassing in public when I'm taking pictures (and) people are looking at me taking pictures of her. But you got to do what you got to do sometimes. She also takes good pictures of me.â€

â€‰ Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com Kylie Jenner is living her best life on a luxury vacation on a yacht in Greece. The Kylie Cosmetics founder, 27, shared a group of photos to Instagram showing off her trip. 'Greeeece,' the mom of two captioned her update. In the first image, The Kardashians star wore a tiny yellow and black Chanel string bikini as she sat on her knees on the yacht. Kylie tipped her head to one side in the shot and looked like she was rolling her eyes. In another snap, the reality TV star showered off as she climbed back onto the boat after a swim in the sea. In another photo, Kylie poured herself into a tiny leopard print bikini that highlighted her toned figure. She also shared a picture with her bestie StassieÂ Karanikolaou at a restaurant in a quaint Grecian town. Kylie turned up the heat with a photo of herself leaning against the railing of the yacht in a skin tight, curve hugging white dress. Other photos in the group included a shot of five women's feet in flip flops, a photo of her pink Chanel tote bag and a bunch of nature shots. KhloÃ© Kardashian commented on her sister's post: 'Are you ever coming home?' A fan also mentioned seeing her on the yacht, writing, 'We saw your yacht in paxos!!! We drove past on a boat. hope ur having the best time.' A bunch of other fans commented along the lines of 'Oh girl your life is so fun' and 'what a life.' And many others complimented her beauty with comments such as 'How is someone this perfect' and 'sun-kissed beauty â¤ï¸.' Kylie's trip to Greece comes after she introduced her collaboration with Frankie's Bikinis. The new swimwear collaboration is called Cloud Cups by Frankies Bikinis x KHY. 'I've always loved Frankies Bikinis, and I'm so excited to partner with them to create this collection â€“ with incredibly flattering silhouettes in super soft material, these are the perfect pieces for summer,' Kylie told DailyMail.com in a statement. 'We've incorporated so many fun prints â€“ from polka dots to leopard â€“ and the styles are so comfortable, it feels like they float on your skin while lifting and sculpting. 'One of my favorite pieces is the Heavenly Satin top â€“ the lace detail is so sweet, and it showcases the vintage aesthetic that this collection is all about.' 'Designing this collection with Kylie felt so natural, like two girls dreaming up their perfect swim drawer,' said Aiello, founder of Frankies Bikinis. 'We wanted each piece to lift, shape, and sculpt while wrapping the body in delicate support.' With six bikini top styles, bottoms that range from classic strings to fuller-coverage, and sun dresses and separates, Frankies Bikinis x KHY offers styles for every aesthetic. Beyond swim, Frankies Bikinis x KHY expands into limited edition mini dresses and easy separates. 'KHY aims to redefine the modern wardrobe by offering edited collections that seamlessly blends luxury with everyday style, spanning a diverse range of categories and styles. 'By collaborating with iconic brands and global designers, we hope that KHY will be a platform that delivers access to incredible fashion for everyone,' the company said in a statement. Frankies Bikinis is a female-led lifestyle brand recognized for its on-trend designs, innovative fabrics, and a commitment to crafting styles that make women feel more confident. Founded by mother-daughter duo Mimi and Francesca Aiello in their Malibu home in 2012, the brand has since grown into an internationally recognized company.

â€‰ Happy Face Channel: M-Net (DStv 101) TX Time: 22h00 Genre: Drama, Miniseries Happy Face is inspired by the true-life story of Melissa G. Moore and is based on her podcast of the same name and her autobiography Shattered Silence. At 15, Moore discovered that her beloved father was the prolific serial killer known as the Happy Face Killer. As an adult, she has changed her name and guarded her secret while her father has been serving life in prison. Jumping off from Moore's true-life story, this series follows Melissa (Annaleigh Ashford) and her incarcerated father, known as the Happy Face Killer (Dennis Quaid). After decades of no contact, he finally finds a way to force himself back into his daughter's life. In a race against the clock, Melissa must find out if an innocent man is going to be put to death for a crime her father committed. TVSA Show Page: Magda Louw 3 Coco Chanel: Unbuttoned Channel: S3 TX Time: 18h00 Genre: Documentary The definitive portrait of Gabrielle 'Coco' Chanel, the original influencer whose iconic designs â€“ the little black dress, the jersey separates, the costume pearls, the tweed suit and Chanel No 5 perfume â€“ remain symbols of luxury, style, sexuality and power in the 21st century. Coco was the designer who started a revolution inspired by her own trailblazing and radical appetite for independence. She liberated women from heavy, corseted clothes, giving them freedom to work, move and celebrate themselves. In a male-dominated world, she was rewarded with unrivalled wealth, recognition and celebrity, counting everyone from Winston Churchill to Cecil Beaton as friends. But despite her triumph, Coco remained an enigma. Until her death in 1971 at the age of 87, she veiled the truth of her poor childhood growing up in an orphanage, her early years as a kept mistress and her sense of being a perpetual outsider. She indulged in complex affairs with men, including - allegedly - the married composer Stravinsky, a grand duke who had fled revolutionary Russia and the wealthy Duke of Westminster, who left her for a younger woman. A wartime romance with a German agent led to accusations of Nazi collaboration and Coco's exile from France for nearly a decade. This documentary weaves together the truth of the woman and her work in the closest we have to her own words, based on a series of intimate interviews with her biographer Paul Morand, and voiced by Braveheart actress Sophie Marceau. It includes exclusive interviews with: -Â Coco's long-time assistant Lilou Marquand, -Â Coco's muse of the 60s Jackie Rogers, -Â current Chanel muse Caroline de Maigret, -Â hip-hop stylist Misa Hylton, and -Â supermodel Jerry Hall and daughter Georgia. Coco is revealed by women who knew her and continue to live and wear her vision. This is the culturally defining exploration of a legend whose work reflects the story of the 20th century.
